Reviews.Title: “One night only!!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCohiba
Reviews.Content: In Montreal for a Canadiens game, check- in was a breeze we had an executive suite and a package which included breakfast and parking. Parking is $14/ night and buffer is $20/ pp otherwise. The room was small but well appointed, the bathroom small as well. The only issues were the air did not work at all and the bathroom was filthy. Toilet bowl had black markings around it which appeared to be mold from lack of cleaning. The seat was dirty which we cleaned w personal carry wipes. The sink also had some residue in it and the shower/ tub although clean lacked pressure. We found the Teri cloth like robe for the suite (1) only, rather funny I thought. Positives:The staff here are polite and helpful, bed is a bit hard but fine for 1 night, breakfast was more then adequate but buffet not worth the $. Proximity to the Bell Centre is awesome and we enjoyed our stay despite the cleanliness ( no sense raising issue).

Reviews.Title: “Needs refreshment - good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lau0915
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in August 2010, mainly because of the cheap prices, and I can now say that's its only asset. Hotel is clean, but rooms and corridors need to be refreshed. Don't try breakfast, it's expensive and distasteful. Swimming pool is fine and really useful when you spend your day walking in a hot summer Montreal. Hotel is just behind St-Catherine, so that's really well located if you want to go shopping. I'd say approx 30 mins walking from Old-Montreal, so expect to be a bit tired when you come back from your day visiting this beautiful city. Overall, good value for money, compared to other neighboring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Always my first choice of downtown Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Darksider
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location on multiple trips and have always been very satisfied with my accomodations. The rooms are good, the beds are comfy and the linens are always high quality. The staff are always helpful and friendly. The Hotel's location is excellent being 1 block away from St Catherines. I will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: hholbein
Reviews.Content: the advantage of this hotel is also its problem: the decent price for quality attracts a young and noisy crowd. pot smokers is not uncommon. the room i slept in had a heavily leaking tap and a weird noise from the structures woke me up a few times. location is nice for shoppers, but again, downtown montreal is so large that wherever you end up you have to walk a lot, or take the public transport, which are more efficient than in most western cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Dwight P
Reviews.Content: Very Pleasant stay,great location to all attractions,clean & comfortable. Staff excellent! From the housecleaning staff to the dining room to the front desk staff,very accomodating to guests.In my opinon & those of my fellow travellers a tip of the hat to Karina & Mario who went above & beyond with excellent customer service.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Mario A
Reviews.Content: Spent the past weekend there for the hockey game with our tour company Toursport , and the service was amazing! Courteous friendly staff who were always willing to help our customers out! Looking forward to our next visit in April Mario Arcuri Toursport

Reviews.Title: “Great locale and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Trekker_time
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed here as part of an East coast trip from Toronto to Quebec City. We really enjoyed our stay due in the main to the staff. From the front desk through to the particulary engaging restaurant crew we were made to feel welcome. The hotel is very well located close to the main shopping precincts and walking distance to the VIA rail station. And for the price, this is a good property with a lot to like.

Reviews.Title: “a fine stay for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: LJEY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located and is in decent condition. We took the bus to and from the airport and the hotel is right by the bus stops. Also reasonable walking distance to 2 metro stops, which we used a lot. The room was borderline dingy, but felt clean and maintained. Dated decor - but that was expected. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and attentive. On the first night of our stay - hadn't unpacked yet - I asked the front desk to move us as there was substantial partying going on at 5:00 in the afternoon in the room next door (which didn't bode well for later in the evening.) The front desk clerk first started to find me another room, and then asked why - which I appreciated. The second room was quieter and while we were in the process of moving we came across the night manager asking the noisy guests to close their door and quiet down. We never ate at the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant or bar. My only other comment would be that we often waited a very long time for the elevators on nights when the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located and very clean”
Reviews.Author: AYG_30
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located, easy walking distance from all the major highlights of downtown Montreal. The room was very clean, spacious and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “The overnight staff were very warm”
Reviews.Author: Bilbo76J
Reviews.Content: I came in about 10pm with a friend from Ottawa and the staff were just so warm. Sometime late at night people are grumpy and hotel staff are no exception but Valerie and Kerwin were great. They were attentive and told us about the area and got us into our rooms immediately. The rooms were clean also.The hotel is also in a great location. After driving from Ottawa and having a full day of walking around the Capital I didn't know what to expect in this hotel but they put us perfectly at ease.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Mary A
Reviews.Content: I really liked it here in Montreal! Everything at this hotel was pleasant! Nice pool, gym and boutique shop! I enjoyed my stay here and would repeat it if I come back during the summer! Bought this awesome shirt from their boutique that says MOUNTAIN DUDE! Definitively worth the price I payed!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located right behind Concordia”
Reviews.Author: Abel M
Reviews.Content: The place was clean and everything was in place. The breakfast was very nice and service was fine. I'd recommend this place to anyone on a short stopover to visit the city since this place is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK; Needs Updating and Focus on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CynthiafromOhio2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a bus tour. First the positives: 1. Indoor pool was excellent, well-heated, clean and very large and deep. 2. Bed was comfortable and room was very clean 3. Bathroom was clean and well-appointed The negatives: 1. Rooms were out-dated, drapes and furniture was old and well-worn (except for the mattress). Time to update and re-paint walls. 2. Inadequate elevators -- only two very slow (and not very large) elevators. This was a real problem when the bus tours arrived and departed, but even at other times, the wait was excessive. 3. Front desk staff unfriendly and difficult to deal with. We were a bus tour from Ohio and no one from our group spoke French, which may explain why the staff was rude, but there was no excuse for their attitude. 4. Breakfast buffet was a disaster. Not enough room to seat everyone; buffet not well-laid out and not enough food. In theory, one of the wait staff was pouring coffee and tea, but it never happened. Several tables never received any coffee. I would have rated this hotel poor, except for the great indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “We got robbed..”
Reviews.Author: Shelly N
Reviews.Content: The four of us came to Montreal to spend the weekend (Friday-Sunday) and we had a great time...until we came back on Saturday night to find that our room had been ransacked. Almost 2000 dollars worth of stuff went missing. The hotel staff didn't show any sympathy and didn't offer any support. We had to call the police ourselves and no one really talked to us about the incident at all. They even implied that WE left our door open!!! The security system in place is ridiculous and I do not believe that any guests can feel safe in a hotel with such a weak security system. I did not see a security guard on site, and the front desk was empty at night - with staff coming out from the room after hearing people at the desk. I did not think that a hotel would have such little regard for the security and safety of their 'valued guests'. We definately did not feel valued at all and it was devastating that the police arrived around 730am.......we called at 1am...and again at 2am. To top it off, the fire alarm went off several times throughout the night and the elevators stopped working....so when we had to leave the next day, we carried our luggage down the stairs. Prior to leaving the hotel, we spoke to the front desk and was told that there was nothing they could do at the moment and that they have until noon to send the report to the police (the report that records the key card entry) and I called them around 420pm....still nothing. They couldn't retreive the records???? REALLY???? That just seems really shady to me. I still can't believe this...........we need justice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Conveniently Located Hotel in Downtown Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: BrucedNH
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Maritime Plaza is nice, mid-sized hotel that's located within a few minutes walking distance of many great restaurants, pubs and shopping. The rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. I've stayed at this location on several occassions and have always found the staff to be efficient, friendly and helpful. The hotel offers a good value for the price and is always one of my first choices when visiting the great city of Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: elivorni
Reviews.Content: In 2011 I went twice to Montreal (March and November) and both times I stayed at the Hotel Maritime Plaza. Conveniently located, I noticed the second time that it had also done some renovation. The room (I think I got the same room both times!) was clean and absolutely comfortable: Montreal is such a beautiful city, otherwise I would have been tempted to spend even more time in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: henry c
Reviews.Content: Hello my name is Henry CG , I recently stayed at this hotel , i can not stress this any further STAY AWAY !!!!!! This hotel made my stay in canada horiible , the rooms were messy , tv didnt work , and the noise dont even ask , a bunch of guys running around screaming the whole weekend AT 4 AM . Plus can you imagine not showering for 3 days .... YES THE SHOWERS DIDNT WORK . Theres a hotel down the block called Espresso which actually looks decent .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year Escape”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Montreal with a friend for 3 days/2 nights after New Years as a mini-vacation to rest and rejuvenate before jumping whole-heartedly into 2012. My stay at the Hotel Maritime Plaza helped to facilitate exactly that. Mario, the gentleman who helped my friend and I at the front desk was delightful and very knowledgeable â€“ most of all, he was kind. He upgraded our room to the top floor and offered us the best of the bed options available. Mario also provided options to choose from so that we could have the best view. I explained that it was my first time in Montreal, so he provided suggestions for restaurants and gave visitor-friendly directions, as well as offered help should we need anything else to make the stay as stress-free as possible. I had a perfect time in Montreal. Thanks, Hotel Maritime Plaza staff for making my stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gimper90
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often when in Montreal, as it's close to all the action. They have a parking garage attached to the hotel, so that's convenient for late arrivals. The staff are very nice and everyone speaks English, so there is no worries if you don't speak French. The rooms are comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST STAFF AND HOTEL IN MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Hi I wanted to take this time to recognize and thank you for having a wonderful hotel, but more importantly an amazing selection of employees. I have been staying at the hotel for business trips for over 4 years, and have always experienced the utmost professionalism and hospitality I could ever want. In business today, we sometimes always settle for good, your employees consistently exceed my expectations. I arrived on Oct 19th and was to stay till Nov 5th, however, due to business was extend till the 19th of November. Now for most that would mean time away from family and friends, I agree, but your staff have been my family and friends making my stay like I was home. From the front desk employees who always expressed warm friendly service greeting me each morning and night with a smile and a hello. Outstanding achievement in hospitality go to :Karina, Valerie,Asalia, Karina, Gilles. To the night time manger Mario, who though recently new to the hotel, right away made me feel welcome and appreciated. Bastien for ensuring my stay was perfectly arranged and all request were meet with truly exceptional service, I was treated not just as another business customer. And Denis for ensuring my room service was always exactly as ordered and delivered with a smile. Last but most importantly and truly a value add to any stay is Carmen for making my stay incredible. Carmen goes beyond customer service and makes you feel like you are the only one in the hotel, which when away for a month is very important. I return to Ontario all the time spreading the word that if you stay in Montreal, the Maritime Plaza is the only choice and say hi to Carmen for me. Last the hotel, overall it is the best and again never disappoints, please continue to do what you do best deliver outstanding customer service. I cannot thank everyone mentioned enough form all your assistance, care and making my stay enjoyable. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Central location with everthing that you need”
Reviews.Author: Bob499181
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after checking trip advisor reviews. We found that this hotel, although an older complex, had everything which we needed including underground parking and a very nice pool. Its central location made walking to shopping and to the Bell center a great choice for us. The staff were friendly and the price was reasonable. Access to the hotel by car was not to bad for City driving.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: schlmiel
Reviews.Content: I was there with a tour group. The hotel is heavily booked by groups especially during the fall "leaf peeper" tour season. This is a first class hotel and is well located near the center of Montreal. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. St. Catherine's Street is only a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: quiros_lazaro
Reviews.Content: Very good area, clean, quite, very high professional and helpful reception staff ( Mohamed and Azalia). A/C was not to good. The only complaint: Breakfast at the restaurant ( Foods cold and no good service). And too expensive for hotel guests. We'll be back to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Take NOTICE”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: My experience at the hotel was terrible - bad. It was just problem after problem. First it started that my 'confirmed' rate actually was an error and the front desk agent was do kind as to offer me a choice, pay the higher rate just for the first night and vacate the hotel for the remaining of my reservation OR not register at all and simply pay $100 OR do nothing! What a gift! I called 11 hotels in the area and every one was fully booked! Then there were No towels, there was still coffee left in the machine, coffee pouches were empty, food left under the table, water would NOT drain out of the tub at all. Spoke with front desk to tell them and it seemed they blamed everyone else for the problem. I parked in the underground parking and my car was broken into, the men there working the parking watched me by the corner of their eyes as I approached my car and noticed the theft. They claim they don't no nothing! Contact front desk and they tell me they lease it out, so they are not responsible! Called police and they tell me that this is very common in hotels! Complained to manage and was told that he/she would contact me ASAP-NEVER happened! After arriving home, I called and asked for the manager and told him about my horrible ordeal, he asked if I would email him the information, which I did. Waited three days only to be told that he does not believe me! I asked him, talk to the housekeeper and ask about the coffee, food and empty coffee. Ask the maintenance man about the drainage. Ask front desk about the theft. I gave him the file number from the police. This meant NOTHING to him, because he DOES NOT CARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller2371
Reviews.Content: not to much to say okay for a couple of nights stay could do with updating but was clean but worn and a bit tired .we were on the 7th floor and it was very warm air con in the room didn,t cool room at all .close to center lifts very slow especialy if a coach load arrives quicker to walk up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the lifts”
Reviews.Author: DCSouthport
Reviews.Content: I was here as part of a tour group, and that's the problem! The hotel is well used by coach parties, so that getting down in a lift in the morning is mayhem. Tip - get in at any opportunity, even if you are going down and the lift is going up! The room was fine, clean, well equipped (I enjoyed using the DVD player), but with no fridge or microwave. Ideally situated for shops and restaurants, and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Fire safety issues”
Reviews.Author: Gillian B
Reviews.Content: This review is in response to a request to provide feedback so that management will address fire safety issues at the hotel. We stayed at the Maritime Plaza for 3 nights between 20-22 September 2011 as part of a Travelsphere tour. On our last night, the fire alarm sounded at 11.30pm and everyone filed down the stairs (we were on the 14th floor!) into reception. Progress was very slow, at times hindered, and in no way assisted by hotel staff. No-one knew where to assemble and there were no announcements from hotel management. Luckily, it transpired there was no real fire and the alarm had been set off by workmen. Apparently this is not the first time it has happened. I was shocked that no-one seemed to take control and, without announcements by our tour guide, no-one would have received any information or reassurance during the hour or so we had to wait around for the firemen to do their thing and declare the building safe. That said, the hotel does have many benefits: good location, in the city centre, just a few minutes walk from the main shopping street (Catherine Street) and a supermarket, McDonalds and Dominos Pizza. Our room was bright and clean and, being on the top floor, had lovely views over the city (Floors 8-14 are so-called executive floors). A couple of other points: As others have also stated, the lifts are always very busy! A beer in the bar costs $9.

Reviews.Title: “To save others a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: BrianT422
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the proffessional photos This hotel looks sad externally and is sad internally. The surrounding area was not clean with rubbish & litter on the sidewalks. The rooms are old and shabby not clean and the bed pillows were stained and smelled of body odours. We were warned by locals to stay to the brightly lit areas for our own personal safety. After visiting Toronto, Quebec & Ottawa this was the only time we felt nervous for our safety Definitely not recommended, at any price! BrianT.

Reviews.Title: “If You're Stuck...Looking For A Place To Crash Downtown...”
Reviews.Author: Tylervin
Reviews.Content: It is what is it is - a centrally located hotel that shows its age and lack of a modern decor. Less expensive than other options, bit of a musky smell in the smallish rooms. Need new faucets and taps for the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karly478
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby decor not very inviting when we first entered, lifts are a bit slow and we waited 5 minutes on one occasion to get the lift. At around 11.30pm on our first night the fire alarm sounded and all the guests congregated in the lobby, the staff did not check all the guests were out of their rooms and it took approximately 10 minutes for the fire brigade to arrive, that could constitute a health and safety hazard; fortunately it turned out to be a false alarm; however they did not even offer a free breakfast the next morning, we had to just go back to our rooms, many of the guests had to climb up several flights of stairs because one of the lifts did not work and the other we would have had a long wait as there was a queue. There is no live entertainment, and for a hotel this size thats quite disappointing. On a positive note the rooms were clean, and the reception staff were quite friendly but looked a bit bored, the shower in the bathroom was pretty good too. The cooling system had to be turned off as it could get quite cold otherwise but that was easy to remedy once we found the control on the wall. The waiter in the dining room was very friendly and had a good sense of humour, the food was quite good in the dining room, except they put shellfish on top of salmon which was not mentioned on the menu, and if one does not eat shellfish that could put you off your dinner, however it tasted fine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable centrally located Montreal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: As a Director of a few Boards of Public corporations based in Montreal, I have found a near ideal balance of comfort, location and value which sets a good example in managing travel costs so important in today's business environment. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed with sufficient wireless bandwidth to connect multiple internet devices simultaneously for entertainment and emails. The hotel restaurant has a excellent buffet breakfast and while the evening fare is a bit limited, it has always been well prepared and reasonably priced. The staff are friendly and helpful. This hotel is located close to both the business, shopping and the educational facilities in the area. I have encountered a number of tours using the hotel but they seem to be very efficiently handled and did not stress me as a business traveller. If I was bringing family on a trip to Montreal, I would consider this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bansteadfamily
Reviews.Content: The room was good and the pool was good. Location is fairlyaccessible to most things. The lifts are very slow and many times we gave up and took the stairs. The stair exit on the swimming pool level was half blocked by piles of chairs which we had to squeeze through. Given that this is a fire exit this must be a serious health and safety risk. The hotel was very busy and for the three nights we stayed there were coaches outside the hotel and there was always a small crowd of people just outside the hotel smoking. The rception staff were rude and unhelpful which is not what you expect in the hotel industry. On our first day there Montreal caught the tail end of Hurricane Irene and the weather was very wet and windy. We decided to eat in the hotel restaurant that night but there was one waiter and one chef on duty and the waiter warned us that it would all take a while. After 30 minutes he still hadn;t taken our order and after 40 minurtes he advised us to go back to our room and order take away. Eventually and belatedly he closed the restaurant at about 8.30. The waiter was the only one who apologised. The reception staff looked very bored as they handed over take away menus to several families. Parking is very expensive on site and there are cheaper overnight parking lots in the roads either side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “in dire need of a refurbishment and much more attention to the daily cleaning”
Reviews.Author: alinnna
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the location and on the good reviews on tripadvisor at the time of the booking. We found the price to be most satisfying. Upon arriving we quickly understood the reason. The location is indeed central, within a walking distance to a good deal of interesting sites downtown (Museum of Fine Arts, Rue St Catherine, Crescent Street). The room though was shabby, with outdated furniture both in age and design. Almost all the corners, along with a line of carpet along the walls were covered in thick dust. The whole carpeting of the room was pretty dirty, not a nice sight at all. On the positive side, the personnel at the reception was kind and efficient both for the check-in and the check-out. And also the staff in the underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay hotel IF you find a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: Thonger
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Ottawa and decided to visit Montreal for a couple of days. The main reasons we chose the Maritime Plaza was because we found a good rate on a travel site and because they had a pool. Location was pretty good as it's only a block away from St. Catherine's Street. The room we got for that "good rate" was the smallest room on the entire floor. We noticed on the floor plan later that the other rooms were all much larger. We noticed the room was very dusty when we first checked in, so I'm not sure if it was sitting empty for a while. There were also a few dead bugs on the window sill. The door was also stuck. We couldn't get in at first and thought the front desk staff didn't program the key properly. A bell hop was passing by and offered to help and even he had problems opening the door. He had to really put his shoulder into it to get it opened. At least 3 other neighbours had problems with their keys and/or doors as well. Before the bell hop helped us, we went back down to the front desk to tell them, and they were quite rude. It may be just the typical Montreal attitude, but it certainly isn't acceptable in a service industry. I noticed another reviewer also found the front desk staff rude and implied the problem was the guest's fault. The bathroom was also very tiny without much shelf space. It was fairly clean, but the tub was filthy. My wife was going to take a bath and ran a towel across it to clean it. When she looked at the towel, it was FILTHY! She wound up not taking a bath. Water was very slow to drain out of the tub too. Another big minus was that there is only 2 elevators for a 14(?) floor hotel! A huge tour checked in at the same time as us and we had to wait for a very long time to get to our room. The bell hop chose that particular moment to transport the tour group's luggage to their rooms, locking one of the two elevators out of use!!! So there was only one elevator to transport all those people up and down a 14 story hotel! I could not believe it! Parking is extremely expensive and the lot is extremely narrow. We had a large rental car and it was a very tight fit getting it down the ramp and into the parking spot. Parts of the ramp are single lane for cars going up and down! Fortunately we didn't meet any cars going in the opposite direction when we were on the ramps because it would have been difficult to back up or down those narrow ramps. The pool was very nice. It's a salt water pool and not heavily used. There's an outdoor patio facing Guy street, but it was too cold to use when we were there. Another plus was that there was a safe in the room. The pool made it an okay stay, but we would likely find another hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel - Quiet except Saturday Night”
Reviews.Author: killerbusiness
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel, right off the highway, and close to downtown. Stayed from Wednesday thru Sunday in a room right beside the elevator. Didn't hear anything until Saturday - when a bunch of kids were drunk and making noise in the lobby. We used the pool once. It was nice because no one else was there. Notes: Very firm mattress Very powerful shower

Reviews.Title: “Was going to be higher>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>”
Reviews.Author: single-dad-glos
Reviews.Content: Food is good and dinner is good value, very good food and service. rooms good a bit tired, noise at night in the corridor, staff a bit hit and miss on the front desk some drag down trhe standard. booked a trip, they left answerphone message for the tour company which was not received so we had wait around for next available trip i phoned from the quay to be told that they will refund the deposit / commission that I had paid, when got back the woman behind the desk implied it was my fault, the front desk manger next morning did not accept they had made a mistake, still no refund it is only few dollars!. WARNING we were in our room had been cleaned and no need for a visit from the cleaning team, NO KNOCK, and a female entered the room saw us and went again without saying anything, mentioned to the front desk heard nothing more! ONLY TIME IN CANADA WORRIED ABOUT HONESTY & SAFETY in a hotel and we did West to East 8 hotels in sixteen nights

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Abbasec
Reviews.Content: We actually loved the room, two double beds and a really good view. Everything was clean, no problems. However others on our tour had problems, one couple actually found what they called blood stains on the carpet and others complained about uncleanliness. But personally speaking it was great, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased with almost everything”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights and were quite satisfied with the accomodations. The rooms are as pictured. Beds fairly comfortable. Four pillows per bed! Bathroom clean and updated. Great water pressure! Our room was on the back of the hotel and very quiet except for one night when the people in the next room came in late. If you are a AAA member don't expect a free breakfast even though it states that clearly in the Tour Book. The hotel wouldn't honor it. AAA has said they will reimburse us. The dining room and breakfast is nice but cost about $30 for two of us. The hotel is in a convenient location. Two blocks from the Metro and close to a lot of dining choices. We did enjoy our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Average. It's basically "a place to sleep"”
Reviews.Author: crazeecanuck_11
Reviews.Content: It's basically your average, middle of the road type of place. Lower your expectations, the pictures posted on the website seem to over-promise and very much under-deliver. I'm guessing that the pictures were for the executive class rooms, because it was quite beautiful and new on the website. We stayed in the regular double room, and it didn't really look like that at all in person. The hotel seems quite old, a lot of things are run down. Elevator was slow enough that we just walked up and down the stairs. The restaurant/bar had a bit of a early 90s feel to it. Rooms seemed clean, but old. In other words, though it was clean, it still had the feeling of dirty. We rented several rooms, and all the beds consistently felt as if a bunch of kids had spent the last 10 years jumping up and down on them and killing the springs. Worst of all was one of the beds had a metal spring coming out of the bed. That made for some gashing cuts on my friend's leg! Ouch! Again this is just a product of the furniture being old. I guess the plus side was the location. You're right around the corner from Ste. Catherine and a few minutes walking to Crescent Street. Also getting out of Montreal was very easy as it was very close to the highway. In our case, the only downside, was we probably needed to be closer to St. Laurent, so it was a $10 cab ride away and not really a walking distance type destination. We booked on hotwire on the Unpublished Hotel Rate, so I was a bit disappointed when this came in the same class as 3-star which is supposed to be comparable to Holiday Inn, Radisson, Double Tree. We later passed what looked to be a much newer Holiday Inn, also in the downtown core, and I was a bit envious.... Overall, it's a place to sleep, but basically only that. I wouldn't spend much time in the hotel. And if you needed to prioritize location (especially to Bell Centre, to Crescent Street or to Concordia U), it's a place consider. Given the experience, especially the metal springs, personally, next time, I'll probably not risk the unpublished rate on hotwire, and check out another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great service and room”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The room we ordered was not 100% ready when we got there, so we got bumped up to a bigger room. The bigger room was really nice, king size bed was comfy, view from the windows were great, really clean, 2 TV's and kitchen. People at the desk were friendly. The only issue if any was that the parking garage was ok but a little tight.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Horrible Venue”
Reviews.Author: MzunguwaKenya
Reviews.Content: We seldom take the time to write a review on Trip Advisor but had such a bad experience at this venue that we decided to do so for future potential guests. Our recommendation; stay away! The service was not only lacking, it was totally missing! Guests get no support and assistance in any way, other than when the hotel is taking payment. This filters down from the management I believe, as when we asked to speak to David, the Duty Manager, he advised us that he was a very busy man and demanded to know what we wanted before he could spare us a moment of his busy time. I am in the hotel industry and the general standard is that, when a guest wishes to speak to a manager, the guest gets priority. Not in this venue. We found the venue old and not overly clean. It is centrally located, which is one of the reasons why we selected it, but it is not worth the visit. Stay away if you want a happy holiday!

Reviews.Title: “good value, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssrtb
Reviews.Content: Maids were very friendly, even knowing who we were in the hallways. only 2 towels for 3 and no face cloths, one day no soap or shampoo. tv 20 inch CRT. charged 5 nights parking for a 3 night stay... shower pressure is amazing....CAA book says free internet and breakfast for all but when you get there that is not the case even if you show them the book and explain about false advertising. close to concordia, and shopping , very convenient. all in all good value for the money in downtown Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Fatima0820
Reviews.Content: I had a medical meeting at the Sheraton in Montreal, even with the association discount the rooms were about $370 a night, I decided to stay at the Maritime Plaza as it was only 4 blocks away and the special room rate was about $96 US a night. The room was big, very comfortable and I got to visit the rooms of some of the other participants at the Sheraton and their rooms were not as nice as the one at the Maritime, the front desk people were very helpful, and considering how expensive rooms in Montreal are, this was the greatest value, best location, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average everything else.”
Reviews.Author: dr_robut
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, other than a balled up children' sock that was hiding behind the curtain in the corner of the window. Some details on the room: - Air conditioning worked great. Windows don't seem to open. - No fridge, instead only ice at the third and fifth floors - Amazing water pressure in the shower - Beds are pretty comfy - TV is a fuzzy CRT (not that we watched it much) About the hotel: - The indoor pool is supposed to be saltwater, but smelled a lot like chlorine. It's a decent size and we had fun splashing around for a bit. - Front desk service was fine. Nothing spectacular. - Parking is roughly $10/day in the underground lot. - Free wifi, but the signal took a while to really take. My friend couldn't check emails and location services didn't work on my ipod for the first hour or so. All in all, the place was nothing special, but the price was right considering it's situated a block away from shopping and touristy bars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkon
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from June 23 to June 27 to attend a workshop at Concordia University. The location was great since it is near the University and the city center. The rooms were basic and very clean, but the corridors smelled horribly. Also, the windows in the rooms could not be opened, so no fresh air! My room was facing rue Guy, but I had no problems with noise... My biggest complaint is about the food. Although all staff was excellent, the food was below average. The breakfast buffet was not rich at all, and the dinner was just fine. The best dish I tasted was the carrot soup and the worst (by far) the angus burger. Overall, it is a great hotel for business trips, it offers the basic, the stuff is really great and helpful and I would stay there again, if I was in Montreal...

Reviews.Title: “We hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wacked_fish
Reviews.Content: Poor service, rude attitude, crappy place, I would not recommend choosing this hotel, I have a STRONG negative towards this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: SeaofCyn
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal from Toronto to see the Lady Gaga concert. Hotel was wonderful as were staff with directions and suggestions for dinner. Pool was fantastic! Great clean room and perfect for the 4 of us overnight!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: I know there's reasons for not liking this hotel (it's a bit off the beaten downtown Montreal track, it's an ageing property), but really, having stayed here a few times during the last few years, I love coming back here. Here's the thing, they don't engage in trying to milk you out of your money at all cost. Internet is included and works. The room was impeccably clean, in case you care about the bathroom accessories, it's all crabtree and evelyn. I stayed on the executive floor (like the last few times). The rooms are pretty small and one can't help but wonder how much smaller a regular room might be. We've had dinner in their restaurant (free wine with main course - don't touch the free wine, it's horrendous). The food was great, service fantastic. Compares this to what I wrote about the Gatineau Best Western. It's about the same price category, but really, what a world of a difference. If you need to stay in a well-maintained property in Montreal, and you don't mind having to walk a bit to get to the historic bits of town or to the gay village (if that's where you plan to go), consider the Maritime Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Central to city, but.......”
Reviews.Author: highflights231
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. The higher end room was small. The bathroom was very small, and the bed was too hard. Almost as hard as carpeted floor. Even the 10th floor was noisy from the road traffic. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast offerings were plentiful. The location was great for the Metro and within walking distance to restaurants, museums, Centre shopping, and the parks. The F1 GP was this weekend, and easily a 20 minute Metro ride. Old Town and all its activities are a few Metro stops away. The population is helpful and very friendly easily going from French to English. A good visit getaway city. It is a city if young 20-30 somethings...vibrant. And yes I would return here if they made a bedding change. The lower value ratings was because the F1GP cost went from ~$169 up to $399 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauld581
Reviews.Content: Stayed there June 2011, for an academic business trip. I found the hotel by and large a decent stay. It is across the street from a 747 bus stop (from Trudeau airport), so getting there from the airport is very easy. The hotel is close to two metro stops, and there are also bus stops close by. It is a two-three block walk to the restaurants and bars of Rue Crescent, and Rue Peel is also close. The hotel does not provide a refrigerator, so if you want one it will cost you extra (~$14 Canadian). They do provide wifi for no additional charge. The only complaint of any import is that the elevators are extremely slow and you may find yourself just walking up and down the steps. That could be a good thing, health-wise, but it's not always convenient. There's also mirrors everywhere so if you are not comfortable seeing your reflection everywhere you go you may not like this place. I actually stayed in two different rooms: a double on a lower floor, and a single with queen on one of the so-called executive floors (10 -14). Both rooms were clean and comfortable, with generous bathrooms and excellent water pressure in the showers (always a plus!). Both rooms had coffee makers and coffee, creamer, etc was provided daily. The staff was helpful albeit a bit harried, as this was Canada Grand Prix week. I did not eat anything from the hotel kitchen so I cannot really speak to the food. Overall, I found this Hotel to be perfectly acceptable and drama-free, if not remarkable. I paid ~$120 a night, but this was a special rate for our conference. During Grand Prix week all the downtown businesses jack their rates way up, so I felt lucky to have this relatively low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Louisbean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location in Montreal, but there were several hairs in the bathtub, as well as on the top of the duvet cover. One hair may be missed when cleaning the tub, but several is not a miss but simply not clean enough. Waited more than 10 minutes to check in, no greeting. There was 1 person waiting for fax to be sent or something, and each time the front desk employee came to give them an update, did not even acknowledge me. Check out was fast and friendly (different employee)

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: bharathmreddy
Reviews.Content: This was hands-down one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. THe rooms were extremely small, dingy and had antiquated decor. It is no better than a road site motel and the fact that it received a 3 star rating is a joke. Our room was not cleaned and the house-keeping lady got into a major argument with my wife when the room was not done even until 5PM. It was not until we complained to the manager that someone even came up to address it. The bathroom was dirty and had drainage problems with the sink and bathtub. Overall, just a terrible, disgusting place that should be banned from being open. The whole place should be shut down. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnahitaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights/7days . I had a very important meeting on my last day, and the staff were very nice to cooperate with me, which eased my stress. My room was clean and neat , and the cleaning lady was super nice, making sure that everything is OK in my room. The first two nights of my stay was during the weekend, and they were a couple of young folks who made terrible noise... I should have called the reception, which I didn't. But my suggestion is when they come to the hotel in a group, ask them to sign some regulations, so that if they made noise or damaged the room properties they pay fines! I got a good deal from the main website because I reserved it very early. I recommend this hotel to everyone. The location is great, it's near the heart of the city, and you have easy access to everywhere such as Merto, and bus shuttle to airport. will be back to this hotel whenever I come to montreal

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LDAW_TO
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maritime Plaza had been recommended by a colleague who's stayed there in the past. I booked with an earlybird special for just over $100 for the night. I arrived by train and walked there in about 10 minutes. The desk staff were friendly and efficient, the room was clean and comfortable, and free wi-fi was a plus. This will be my first pick next time I need a place in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenent Location - Questionable Security”
Reviews.Author: traggat
Reviews.Content: While the bed was a little hard the hotel has nice accommodations. The location was great, within walking distance of two metro stations on two different lines. Parking in the hotel was reasonably priced and great if traveling to Montreal by car. My big worry was security. On the final night in the hotel we received a phone call at 4:00 a.m. from someone who knew our room number and how many people were in the room. The lady identified herself as the front desk, stated that we only paid for two of the three people in the room (which was false), and demanded we immediately come to the front desk to pay for the third person. I hung up and immediately called the front desk. They said they had no idea who the person could be, refused to believe there was a breach in an employee making the call or giving out our information and blamed us for giving out that information. I got the same response the next morning when I brought this up with the front desk in person. It would have been nice to hear them at least offer to look into the incident.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, probably won't go back as business traveller unless office can't afford another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MEM_11
Reviews.Content: Great location. Courteous staff. Clean room. Sparkling bathroom. However as business traveller it is not conducive to a good stay. Problems encountered: elevators broken. this meant that on a morning that I had to leave by car with luggage and work materials, I couldn't get an elevator down for 20 minutes. I almost hit rush hour in Montreal - however I was late getting back to my office in Ottawa. The Breakfast: I need breakfast by at least 6:30 so I can leave the hotel before 7. Unfortunately their breakfast starts at 7:00. The Pool: As a business traveller, I like to swim before my morning shower or departure. Not possible, the pool doesn't open til 7 a.m. Mattress: second rate. Radio: I listen to radio. call me old fashioned. The radio in my room was awful. Horrible tinny sound. Ruined each of three mornings getting ready to start my day where the only news and traffic report I'm going to get is between 6 and 7 as I will be in meetings from 7:30 to 5:30 p.m. Check In: The first room they offered was on the 2nd floor (214) Avoid if at all possible. There had probably been a smoker in the room. It had a view of a parking lot. It was VERY noisy (fronted on a very busy street). Carts: Lots of available carts. However, the wheels need alignment so you don't crash into the doors and on the narrow elevators. Choose carefully. I went down to complain, another front desk person (Paulo) gave me a room on the 5th. And offered complimentary breakfast (which had been part of my rate that the first person should have told me). The room was fine. All was good. On check out, I told them why I probably would not be back. They told me that I should have asked for an "executive room", higher up in the hotel, better mattress etc. I told them that if that was supposed to be part of my corporate rate, they should have offered in the first place. (One of the people kept saying, you should have asked (??).) On the whole, the staff were friendly and helpful. Neither my colleague nor I will go back for either of the two visits we have upcoming in June. But if you need a good price with a few amenities like pool, it's not a bad deal. Not for business travellers though on a tight timeline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Dranica
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great, service was extremely friendly and pleasant, Breakfast hot and fantastic Variety. Went to the hotels webiste directly and purchased their includsive package. Great value!!! Will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: noname075
Reviews.Content: rooms facing Guy pick up noise from the traffic. Would be nice if hotel had sound resistant windows. Changed room to east side and was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: habs1909
Reviews.Content: As always really enjoyed our stay. The room was excellent. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Natalie and Pabulo where the first last year to welcome us to the hotel and we were sold since then. Great staff will go out of the way to make sure your stay is relaxing and stress free. Thanks for every thing that you do for us.

Reviews.Title: “great first time in Montre'al”
Reviews.Author: elivorni
Reviews.Content: the room could have been cleaner (there was a bottle screw on the floor) and by Friday night the room had not been made yet. Other than that, the hotel is conveniently located and the personnel is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “As long time visitors to the Maritime Plaza we were disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: jmarr
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was very dirty; there was glass on the carpet, the bathroom floor was filthy - including fingernails (yuck). There was some large group on our floor and they partied all night long - I called the front desk 4 times throughout the night and each time the noise would stop for about 30 minutes and then start up again - we didn't get any sleep at all. The toilet ran for long periods of time and the bathtub faucet leaked constantly.Our cable didn't work, although they came up and fixed it for us fairly promptly. We have used this hotel for many years and will not be using it again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, deceiving appearance, nice bedding on executive floors”
Reviews.Author: Idolconcerts
Reviews.Content: I was deceived by all the dirty trays full of leftovers forgotten on the floors. The carpets on the corridors were really dirty and due to a replacement. Upon arrival, the room had a strong smell of chemicals. I do not know what it was. The corridors we extremely loud. Young people moving in crowds and yelling at all times. Service wise, I requested the staff to close the access to the phone and to all extra services. In the end, I found myself with a restaurant bill and some phone calls that I did not authorize. I was forced to pay as I did not want to embarrass my client, yet, I expected the desk to give attention to my directives. Overall, it could be a nice place, but it looks like the management does not give iimportance to the details that make a hotel stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in the heart of Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Leah-Ben
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Maritime hotel. My husband and I stayed there with our two grandsons for 5 days. The hotel meet all of our needs and its central location removed some of the transportation costs we had planned for the trip (no taxis, buses, etc) The room was very large, the staff very helpful. We plan to send another week in Montreal and already plan to stay at the Maritime hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: LilyOttawa
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Staff is very helpful and nice. Carpets in the room were not very clean, I think they should be changed, they are old. Sheets were clean, although one had a little whole where we can see it, it was on of the first thing I saw. One thing I didn't like is that there was a tray with old food sitting in the hall all afternoon, since we checked in. At night. I told the desk, but he said it should be one of the maids that forgot it there and didn't give much importance to it. It looked gross. We also used the swiming pool, it had a nice temperatura and view. Overall, it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located - Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: MissTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: I just took VIA Rail to Montreal after a 7 year hiatus from visiting that amazing city. I was booked to stay at the Delta in Centreville, but the reviews on Trip Advisor weren't very good, so last minute I decided to change to Maritime Plaza Hotel, based on their reviews. Hmmm what can I say. I was there for two nights. A lot of men seem to stay at the hotel...The staff are very friendly and accommodating, but it is a 3 start hotel. I went into my first room but there was no way I could stay in there. The room smelled damp and dank, the carpet was not clean, the bed linens had stains and there were hairs on the sheets... it really was all too much for me within 5 minutes of walking into the room. So, I called the front desk and told them I could not stay in the room it was very dirty. When I went back downstairs I was given an upgrade at no extra cost to the executive suites. This room was probably more the calibre of a regular clean room. It was clean and didn't smell as damp as the other room. My view was excellent...I didn't quite know how to use the heat, but when I called they sent a guy up with another additional portable heater. The bathroom was pretty clean but the shower only had one strange setting... very forceful I guess and when I tried to change the setting the entire shower head fell off. So, I had to get used to that small but powerful force of water for my showers. They have wireless internet which was good and the location is excellent. It's right downtown, close to St. Catherine's Street and not far from VIA Rail. It's easy to catch local buses or the Metro from there. I did not have the breakfast buffet because I was not very hungry but it looked really good and was only $14.00. Would I stay there again? I think so...but only in the Executive rooms upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “How much do I hate thee, let me count the ways”
Reviews.Author: caffinate
Reviews.Content: Nothing good about this hotel NOTHING. I was staying here for two nights and someone else was paying, still I left after one night at this horrid place. Oh and I was on the executive floor in a bigger room than average!!! 1-Elevators suck. There are two, slow elevators for 14 floors. One of the elevators is almost always occupied by a service cart, so the other is full of people and stopping on every floor. 2- Beds suck. They look pretty and all. But upon arrival I noticed hair on my pillows. Wasn't my hair. When I got in to sleep it was like owww. Hard bed. Uncomfortable and I didn't sleep well probably cause of the bed but also because 3-Dusty- the air vent was filled with dust. I noticed that my allergies start acting up soon after I got in the room. When I later discovered the dust in the air vent, I knew why. 4- Exercise room, really? Three cardio machines (that's all) and all of them are about 20 years old. I went in there and two people were already using the gym, so no room for me, literally. Ok I could have used the stepper, but if I wanted to climb steps I could just walk up to my room (and avoid the 10 minute elevator wait and 10 minute elevator ride). 5- Waiters have amnesia??? I went to breakfast which was subpar, everything seemed to have come frozen in a box and warmed up oh and they charge $15 for that. Ok also by the time I grabbed my food, someone else was sitting at my table and drinking my coffee. When the waiter came over he acted like it was the first time he had seen me (even though he had seated me 3 minutes earlier). 6- Coffee maker and DVD player were in the room. Coffee pot was broken and dirty. DVD player did not work even after I followed the directions to a T. 7- Tub did not drain. Like everything else in the hotel, probably due to years of neglect (and piles of hair). At the end of my shower (with the drain open) I was standing mid-calf deep in water. I think that's all, but I'm sure I would have discovered more if I had stayed another night! UGH, stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5Wings5
Reviews.Content: Came to Montreal to go to the Canadians hockey game, Bell Center was 2 blocks away, so convenient. Hotel Room was great, stayed on the top floor, great view. Close to everything that we wanted. Very easy to find hotel off highway. Easiest check-in and check-out ever. Hotel Staff was so friendly and helpful. Pool was very nice and was warm which was really nice. Parking garage was abit hard to get in and out. Really nothing bad at all to say. Great hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Maid from Hell...do NOT book online!”
Reviews.Author: sarahandkyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for New Years this year while in Montreal attending a Canadiens game. The location of the hotel to the Bell Centre and downtown was excellent. That is about the only excellent thing about our stay at this hotel. OH, wait, they have a really great movie selection and THAT is about the only excellent things about this hotel. For starters, we pulled into the smallest parking garage known to the face of man, barely able to find a spot. Once checked in, we went to our room to discover stains on the walls, in the bathroom, and the main sitting chair in the room. We tried to give this hotel the benefit of the doubt seeing as we checked in on New Years eve and we knew there would be a lot of teenagers partying at the time, but our experience continued to get worse. Around noon the second day of our stay (we had booked online for a 2 night stay), the maid tried to kick us out. When we finally got a call from the front desk to go down and sort the mistake out, we were accosted by the maid in the hall and told that we were mistaken about how long we had booked and to get out. When downstairs in the lobby, the front desk staff tried to charge us their regular rate for the room, despite the fact that we had booked online for a special discount. AND when we went to leave on the Sunday, the parking garage attendant tried to get us to pay for ANOTHER day of parking. We really had a terrible, terrible experience with this hotel...please avoid it, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction & good service”
Reviews.Author: englee1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right downtown, one block away from St. Catherine's street & the nearest subway (metro) station. Three blocks away from the Bell Centre. Perfect location for those who want to sight-see & be close to all downtown attractions. The hotel staff were all very friendly, accommodating & helpful. All were bilingual, so do not worry about not speaking French. As you can use the 747 express shuttle bus, the hotel is very accessible from the airport, without having the expense of a cab ride. At $8.00 each way....it's a real deal & stops right outside the Hotel Maritime Plaza. The hotel has a nice indoor saltwater pool, that my son absolutely loved. It is unheated (or heated very little) though, so be prepared when you jump in!!! There is a small gym / exercise room right next to the pool, several meeting rooms on the mezzanine level and a gift shop on the main level as well as a restaurant. The hotel is tidy but is a bit dated, it could use a bit of a refresher & more regular carpet steam cleaning. Don't misunderstand... it is not dirty, just could be a bit tidier. Overall a good hotel, great location, good amenities & a good rate. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't see why I need to actually type my thoughts...but you'll be glad I did I suppose”
Reviews.Author: mioski19
Reviews.Content: So - this hotel is nice for what it is. I wish it was cheaper, but it was a good price relative to the other hotels in the downtown Montreal area. The pool was one of one of my search criterea, but the free wifi was a very nice surprise. The hotel is right on the corner of one of the 747 stops (the Montreal public transportation express bus from the airport to downtown). It is also a frew blocks from two different subway lines which certainly reminded me of home (NYC). It is also only about a half mile or so from the Bell Centre, which worked well as part of my trip was for a Canadiens game one night, & a concert another. As far as the hotel, the rooms are small, the pool is saltwater - which takes some getting used to, and there are only two elevators which cause some waiting when you come and go - but you get what you pay for. The hotel does seem to attract a younger (potentially bachelor party) crowd - but thankfully none of that was staying too close to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike6398
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel in the past 6 years and both times we loved it. The price is very good, the location is good, the rooms are average but clean and quiet . The staff was very friendly and helpful to me and my wife and kids. The pool was one of the reasons we wanted this hotel and our kids enjoyed it a lot. The free internet WIFI was one reason i wanted this hotel along with the pool for our kids and the location was near Ste Catherine st and the Bell Centre . To our surprise kids under 12 ate free (we didnt know) , this was a big bonus so buffet for the whole family for breakfast was 28$ I would go back if and when we return to Montreal. They could easily make it better by simply getting better TV's , glass cups intead of plastic cups. Bathrooms are a bit small , and we were in executive rooms. queen instead of double beds (but that seems to be common theme in Montreal) But those are just minor things to us. We did ask for real wine glasses and the staff were very happy to give us some.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed my stay here for 2 nights. We ate in the restaurant twice, once for a nice upscale dinner and the second for breakfast. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to walk to most of the hot spots from our hotel and enjoy the Old City. The bed was very comfortable and I had a beautiful view of the city. The room and bathroom were very clean. The pool was smaller than thought it would be, but still a nice place for a dip. They were repairing one of their two elevators, so I ended up taking the stairs a couples times, which was good exercise for me personally. Thanks for a great stay in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: blackhawkron
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money Great location easy walking distance to Bell Center and nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: VictorAuQuebec
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared when I read the mixed reviews, but boy, were we pleasantly surprised! :-) The rooms were average size, and perfectly clean. The bathroom had a nice, upscale theme, like a long forgotten, classy vintage hotel the past. Our room had a decent view of the city and the location was great. The staff were extremely friendly and outgoing. We really felt welcomed. My kids loved them! The televisions were nice and large. The pool was simply blissful, nice, and inviting. I still remember the wonderful warm temperature and it was very, very clean... a pleasure to swim in! The only small criticism I have is the parking fee, which I found a bit excessive, but that's it. The rest was as perfect as perfect as can be! This hotel was actually one of my favorites! I don't know why some people put such negative reviews because my family and I stayed here 3 days, and everything and everyone were simply marvelous from the front desk to the chambermaid. Great stay. Really. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Maritime Plaza has a professional staff is in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: ajsherin
Reviews.Content: Front desk is great â€“ very friendly and professional. Rooms are nice and the location is fabulous. My only complaint and it is a serious one, is that the garage within the hotel is extremely badly managed. The parking staff does not communicate well and is rude. The hotel needs to actively oversee the garage and not outsource the management of the garage. There needs to be some sort of communication between the front desk and the parking garage â€“ parking staff screamed at me over a simple misunderstanding and almost made me late for an important meeting. The meeting was the reason I travelled to Montreal from NYC.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK ONLINE”
Reviews.Author: tmp004
Reviews.Content: I booked online and they messed up my date so when I showed up, I was already charged for a night and did not have the correct dates reserved. They are also uncooperative considering I still paid to stay two nights despite this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Got a Dated Rm + Booger on the Phone!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulela
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown MTL. Public transport steps away. Street parking tricky so I reco you use the hotel's garage or nearby parking lots. Stayed 1 night on the 7th Floor. Was advised at check-in the rm was renovated and not one of the dated rms. Upon arriving in my rm I realized my Q was relative since the rm was dated looking ans reminded me of late 80s early 90s hotel deco. The rm featured 2 comfy double beds with clean linens and didn't have those nasty bed throws that look like everyone and they dig used it as a welcome mat. The TV was the old 90s cat-tube model and a relatively small one at that. The view faced North on Guy St. towards Mont Royal which was a pleasant surprise! But the rm was really small and felt like a big dorm rm at best! The bathroom shower/tub drain refused to drain properly which gets disgusting the more ppl use it. Worst of all, rm cleanliness suspicion was confirmed when I decided to call the front desk to ask for the Internet access code and saw a nice big dried booger on the base of the telephone!!! That's when I decided to touch as few of the items in the rm as possible. Don't bother with hotel bar/resto food, you'll find much better variety and quality a block away on St.Catherine St. I wouldn't stay there in another non-executive lvl room even if some offered it to me free of charge. Cleanliness couldve been rated a 3 out if 5 but the shower drain guck, dirty carpet and booger on the phone just aren't right.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated but conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: expat_expl0rer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very dated and has some odd quirks about it (the parking attendant definitely needs to go on a customer service course) but it's comfortable and conveniently located in the centre of town and reasonably priced. A night or two would be OK, I think the 70's wallpaper and furnishings would get to you by the third day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Hotel Rooms - Unfortunate Fire Alarms Disrupted Sleep”
Reviews.Author: bazarov
Reviews.Content: This review may be a bit harsh given that much of my negative feeling stems from the fact that during my stay, fire alarms went off twice (ending around midnight) while I was sleeping (and scheduled to wake up at 5am in the morning to catch a plane). I docked them a star for these disruptions, although to be fair, sometimes these things are out of the control of the hotel. Still, it does not make for a good first impression. The hotel itself was fine - the staff was friendly enough and the rooms themselves were nicely decorated. There was a bit of a dampness to everything (perhaps it was just overly humid that day), but the overall impression of the hotel was that it was reasonably clean and orderly. The location is also fine - not particularly close to the major attractions, but not particularly far away either. Overall, I found it to be an average hotel - too bad about the fire alarm. Hopefully if you stay here, your experience will be better than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Comfortable Place with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nf42day
Reviews.Content: We recently got three rooms for three nights to stay at this three star hotel via priceline for a fantastic price for an extended family trip to visit Montreal. The reviews I read before I went made me a little apprehensive as to what has priceline given me? I am happy to report I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel's 3* rating is deserved though they could use a little modernization, like adding flat panel tv's instead of the 19" Tube TV's, and better showerheads. The staff are very busy as they seem to have big groups go in and out, and despite all that they were very courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the location is unbeatable if you like to walk the city. Free Wi-Fi is a big plus. The only negative is the bed types are not guranteed before arrival since it is via priceline, though the hotel staff did try to accomodate me when I did arrive but to no avail. I look forward to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: HRT1009
Reviews.Content: The staff were uniformly excellent, the breakfast was first class (all fresh food including the eggs), the room clean and quiet, and the location convenient. Disregard the negative comments you might have read about this hotel. We believe it is one of the best value for money offerings in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Me Thinks SeanKris Doth Overreact”
Reviews.Author: Tomassy
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my husband and I stayed at the Hotel Maritime Plaza. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated, but the staff was great, the amenities were just fine, loved the free wireless and the location was terrific. I would say that if the budget could bear it, the televisions do need to be updated (at least that was the case in our room).

Reviews.Title: “run for your life in opposite direction”
Reviews.Author: seankris
Reviews.Content: omg, what a dump, the rooms were filthy, the staff were like zombies, and the place is stuck in 1976, take my advice, spend the extra hundred bucks and stay in a major chain, my weekend in montreal could have been so much better

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmama1955
Reviews.Content: Booked online and since it was a 30 anniversary trip decided to splurge and choose the suite. Although a little bit more than we would normally spend, we actually ended up booking a couple of extra days. They only have I think 4 of these suites and they include a separate bedroom with T.V., living area with T.V. and a kitchenette. Hugh bathroom and the best part was the view. Windows on 3 sides of the hotel. On one side we were looking down on the main area of the city, window in bedroom looked down on a lovely old church, and on the final side we were look at the Bell Centre and the wharf area. Everything was within walking distance (we actually parked the car and did not drive the who time we were there) and where we didn't walk we took the subway--you can get an unlimited 3 day pass for $17.00 and this lets you take the subway as well and the buses--definately worth the price--it took us everywhere and the subway system was extremely easy to understand. Took in an Ottawa/Montreal hockey game and the Montreal Canadian's museum. Great food, great clubs and a great, great, great hotel. Staff friendly and everything very clean. Only downside--the restaurant in the hotel we felt was too pricey for what was offered--we only ate there for one breakfast-but will all the restraurants and pubs around you wouldn't want to eat in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Maritime of my Life”
Reviews.Author: Graham_and_co
Reviews.Content: Desk staff was polite, but beyond them English was not spoken by employees. Bulky television emitted unpleasant frequencies and swivel stand only rotated towards the window, away from viewer. The shower water was hard and soaked the entire bathroom, including the toilet paper roll directly beside the shower. Previous patrons hair found in fresh linen. Tacky, outdated room furnishings and design.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed and Friendly Reception Desk Personnel!”
Reviews.Author: PRSinervo
Reviews.Content: We had a room on 11th floor with a firm king-size bed and a bathroom with all the toiletries. I appreciated the free bottles of water. Underground parking lot was a bit tight because it was full including a number of pickup trucks! However, the daily rate for guests was reasonable and included in-out privileges. This hotel is not luxurious but is very very comfortable and affordable. Pat S.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Einsteinrib
Reviews.Content: Great localization, rooms and staff. Slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “At least it was only for 1 night...”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel through Hotwire and I was one of the many unfortunate people to get stuck with a no-name hotel, so that's how I ended up at the Maritime Plaza. That was certainly the last time I will ever use Hotwire... Other than being duped into staying here, I see no reason for anyone to choose this hotel out of their own free will. At the entrance, 4 stars are proudly presented. In reality it is a very old and badly maintained 3 star, especially the rooms. So now it couldnâ€™t pass as more than a 2-star hotel, but unfortunately the price does not reflect that. The room size is actually very good, but the problem is that it smells old, like mildew. I asked for another room as soon as I arrived, but the new room smelled just as badly as the first, so Iâ€™m guessing thatâ€™s the norm. The TV is extremely small and old and the windows do not close properly, so most of the noise from the large avenue below can be heard at any time. However, the worst part is probably the bed, which is very uncomfortable, with a very used up mattress. On a positive note, the service e was proper, the bathroom worked ok (still very old, with cracked painting) and they offered free Wi-Fi. The have a parking lot at a decent price ($14), although it was very crammed and hard to manoeuvre. The location is ok, still technically in the city centre. In conclusion, there are numerous better choices to stay in MontrÃ©al for the same price or less. But if youâ€™re stuck like I was, hopefully it is only for 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, Bad parking!”
Reviews.Author: lissy12110
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend, and the hotel itself was exactly what i was expecting from the info given on websites. I was disappointed though that after paying the $15 fee for parking, the parking garage was "full" and I had to park my car a block away in a random gravel parking lot right on the street. Having had my car burglarized while in Montreal before, needless to say I was NOT happy. Probably would stay again if I didn't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good service, clean and close to everywhere in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Retraite543
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maritime Plaza in Montreal from August 9 to 12, 2010. The hotel was easy to locate on Guy Street. We had a small room but was very clean. The hotel is located at a block from Ste-Catherine Street which we appreciated as I wanted to shop a bit. We were at a walking distance from everywhere. The peopIe at the reception were very polite and helpful. We will definitively go back. Francine and Bob

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located about 2 minutes walk from Saint Catherine Street, which is a long street lined with shopping (both cheap and very expensive). Entrances to the underground shopping centre can be accessed on Saint Catherine Street. The hotel, itself, is slightly old and requires a facelift. The lifts are slow. The rooms are of an average size but are quite dark. There is insufficient lighting in the room. Also, my room's airconditioning unit was not functioning optimally. Even when set at 5C, the room was still hot and uncomfortable. The bathroom was old and requires renovation. The tiles are of an odd, unpleasant blue colour which reminds me of my grandparent's bathroom tiles. There is also no safe in the room. However, there is complimentary wireless internet and the beds are comfortable. Four pillows were provided for each bed. Breakfast was OK. The service was good but there was not much variety for hot food. There was a wide variety of fruits, which was fantastic. Overall, the hotel is average. My comments are mainly on small, pedantic issues. It is a fairly comfortable hotel and is located in a prime location. I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been kept up/updated very nicely. Rooms are very clean & pleasantly decorated. 5 minute walk to Bell Centre, minutes to Crescent Street, location is 5 stars. Staff was efficient and relatively pleasant. Nice small pool area and lounge. Parking is the standard 15 bucks a night. To me this is a 2 1/2 - 3 star hotel with a 5 star location and 5 star value. I paid $89.00 including taxes in August on the night of a sold out concert at the bell centre. The hotel is clean & safe and very inexpensive for such a prime location. People nitpicking need a serious reality check. If you expect a 5 star hotel downtown in a major city...PAY FOR ONE! If you want serious value and a location that can't be beat for 89 bucks, you've found it. I'd stay here again and recommend The Hotel Maritime Plaza to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeeNel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maritime Plaza for 6 nights on the 14th floor (Executive room). Excellent location, very friendly and accommodating reception staff, clean room with a beautiful view, very comfortable bed, a lot of little extras (cozy bathrobe, phone in bathroom, paper each morning at your door, cofee maker, etc.). Our cleaning lady was very friendly and accomodating and we always had our rooms done (cleaned, bed was made, fresh towels, bottled water etc.) by the time we returned from breakfast at 9:30 a.m. each day- wow - never experienced that before in any hotels we've been to in various countries and provinces. Yes, there was a bit of a wait for the elevator - but who cares, we weren't in a hurry. Thank you to the staff of this hotel for a wonderful stay - Each of you did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not 4 stars by any means.”
Reviews.Author: theboofer
Reviews.Content: i ended up with this hotel through Priceline, and after reading reviews on this site, i admit i was a bit worried. however, after spending 2 nights there, it turned out to be a great deal at ~$90/night. my mother is a little finicky when it comes to beds, and the general consensus is that the beds in this hotel are very poor. after 2 nights there, i would have to agree that they are definitely not good (very hard and not terribly supportive), but i still slept relatively well. neither of my parents had issues, either. the rooms were pretty clean, and not "tiny" as many people had mentioned. they weren't huge, but they were spacious enough and let's be honest, if you're traveling, you're spending 95% of your waking moments out in the city and not in your hotel room. the
