bathroom was rather small, but the shower was good. i did not have varying water temperatures as others have also stated. i was on the 9th floor, my parents were on the 10th floor, and neither of us has noise complaints. the elevators are definitely very slow, and they should probably have 4 of them instead of just 2. the pool looked pretty standard, but we didn't go in. the bar was okay, not great. not a huge selection of liquors, but a couple decent beers on tap. the bartender was okay, but not terribly knowledgeable (i guess most people don't order a gimlet these days). overall, it was pretty quiet and there was a decent sized TV. we did not eat at the restaurant, nor we did not see many people in there. i'm not terribly familiar with Montreal but the location was pretty good from what i could tell. the subway was a ~4 block walk away, and we easily got to where we needed to go with relative ease. there are some hills to and from the subway, so if you have bad knees, keep that in mind. parking was $14.75/night, underground. many spots are small, but a few are large, and i happened to score one of them. pretty reasonable. overall, at $90/night, this place was a great deal. i'm not sure if i would be as happy with it if i had spent $130-140, and i don't think i would recommend it at that higher price either, but at $90, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Matchbox hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsa0
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel in the hearrt of Montreal. A block away from the main street - bussy and lively shops and entertinmet area...but ( yeah, there is a but...) the quality of the hotel is a 2 star at best. Dated furniture, no fridge, no microwave, and no hot AC - yes no hot AC ! the heating is only turned on in the winter time. We have been here in August and there were a few cold night, but we have been "nicely" told by the receptionists when we asked if there is something wrong with the AC, that is not winter yet ! Parking is a 15$ a day, and don't even think of bringing an SUV at this hotel. It won't fit the underground parking The good thing is WiFi - is pretty good and free. Overall, spend a few $ more and find one other hotel near by. No returning here for us.

Reviews.Title: “So much of what is written here is true...”
Reviews.Author: EdRockster
Reviews.Content: When Priceline gave me this hotel and I checked out the reviews here on TripAdvisor, I was apprehensive... to say the least. Priceline rates the hotel 3 stars, and I have to take issue with that. Our room looked enough like a 3 star room, and was quite comfortable. But the service in the hotel isn't really up to the level the management claims... and I've read their responses to their customers who have written about problems encountered... and oddly... it doesn't seem much has been done. Don't get me wrong. It's a comfortable hotel, and the location is good, especially for folks not wanting to be further east in the Gay Villiage. The biggest problem really is the internet connectivity at this hotel. When we logged on, we could only get to sites that didn't require logging in. For example, we could get to Google, etc. But we could not get to Facebook. We also found that making local calls ended up back at the front desk. They were friendly enough, but it was quite confusing. Eventually, while trying to contact friends in the city, the front desk asked that my partner hold to speak to someone else. And the other person asked to verify his credit card number! I've never heard of such a thing, and we were quite suspicious... and yet... after that, the next time we tried to call our friend, the call went through. (And oddly, late at night, we were able to get connected online.) The room was small, but as I mentioned above, it was comfy. The bathroom is definitely smaller than you would expect at a comparable star level... but the whole room had a cozy nostalgic feel. The common areas were attractive if a little dated. My advice to fellow travelers is to not panic when they find they get this hotel through Priceline and such, but be prepared for some spotty internet service...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misterwhite82
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. I was here on vacation with a friend. The rate that we were charged was overpriced. The front desk personnel are rude in multiple languages. The soda machines didn't work on any floors in proximity to the room in which we stayed. The cleaning crew came at 4PM one day. The parking attendant tried to steal money from us by charging us twice. This hotel is a MUST stay away from while vacationing in Montreal. Let the buyer be aware. Stay Clear of Hotel Maritime.

Reviews.Title: “Great price - but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: deuxcentimes
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Maritime Plaza through Last Minute Deals and paid $87 a night for what was billed as " A 4 Star Luxury Hotel". While the Maritime was nice, clean and friendly, it was not a 4 star hotel. It was worth the $87, but I would have been disappointed to have paid more. The beds were ancient and hard, the bathroom tiny, the shower did not drain and the room itself was rather small. Further, we were on a non-smoking floor that patently had several nearby rooms with smokers so that the smell made it into our room. It was really no better than a Holiday Inn type of experience. I certainly expected a far nicer room/bed/bath. The pluses are location, price, saline pool and friendly reception staff. If this hotel were advertised as a 3 star hotel then the expectations would be amply met.

Reviews.Title: “Staff just walked into the room while we were sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: hwy7dude
Reviews.Content: reported what appeared to be a leak in our bathroom to the front desk. anyway as we were falling asleep i hear the door open. i get up to look and find a staffer in our bathroom. I was like what the !? They said the knocked. I may have been in bed, but theyre the ones dreaming.

Reviews.Title: “This is a two-star hotel. Don't be fooled.”
Reviews.Author: mymanren
Reviews.Content: Made a weekend trip to Montreal. This is my fourth time in the city and each time I've stayed in three-star hotels. I booked this hotel through priceline and got a pretty good deal for Montreal. However, I bid on a three-star hotel and the Maritime Plaza is certainly not a three star hotel. The room is a bit cramped, musty, and had outdated cheap furnishings. The thermostat doesn't really work and the vent had a bad odor. The room was clean, but felt very cheap. The bathroom was also subpar. The shower was too powerful and had major drainage issues. The walls were paper-thin and the tv was from the early 90s. The elevators were awful and parking at this hotel is an absolute nightmare. The only reason you should stay here is if you get a really cheap rate. The staff was friendly and again the rooms were clean, but those were the only pros. Location is good depending on where you want to be in Montreal. I would prefer to be a little bit east of this area.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel for a few nights in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ToniW86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner - and actually celebrated my birthday while in the hotel. The staff were super friendly... front desk was friendly, but the front desk are usually quite serious. We stayed there for 4 nights... I had my birthday there - and my sister got a cake delivered for me... the staff brought it to me on a tray with serviettes. Very nice. Central location. 5 min walk to St Catherine St (main st) and close to Metro. We got it on the cheap through priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near subway and Bell centre”
Reviews.Author: halifaxfin
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very solid 3 star hotel. The room was a good size for Montreal and the airconditioning worked well. There is a smoking hot sundeck outside the pool, and a 3 machine workout room. The spot is 10 minutes from Mount Royal and 2 mins to St. Catherines St. Average shower and bathroom facilities and a great bargain for $80. Didn't eat there, but service at front desk was good. Business centre was one slow working computer that was always busy. Location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good nights sleep DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: RLEtheridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel with a good restaurant, pool, lounge and great location. The pictures of the hotel on their website are very wrong. We checked in and their system was down, so we waited in the lobby and they said it wouldn't be much longer. After about 30 minutes a business traveller went to check in and was checked in right away. My husband went to the counter and asked if we could check in, the girl said of course the system was back up. Why she couldn't tell us when we were sitting in the chairs right across from her I do not no. We get to the room and the odor was absolutely horrible. The carpet was very old, their were dead bugs on the window. The shower temperature changes every 5 seconds. I couldn't sleep at night as the mattress was really old and extremely hard. You could feel every lump in the bed. I phoned down as it was extremely hot in the room and asked for a fan. The front desk agent said she would call to have one sent up, never got the fan. We went down and ask the desk agent where to eat and the only response we got was anywhere, the area has lots of restaurants. In the end we were very upset with the stay, and will never be returning. I have stayed at the Delta Montreal and it was worth the extra 50$ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap price to pay for good service”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIE067
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maritime plaza for three days , the hotel on the outside is out dated , the inside is quite nice . We booked with hotels .com at a very nice rate . When we got there at 3 o clock , it was busy at the desk we needed a room with 1 bed and all they had was in a standard was a small room , room 501 when we got to the room it was too small we went back down to the desk and The lady up graded us free of charge to an executive floor with a king bed at no charge to accomadate us. The room was very nice for the price I payed . Hotel a liitle outdated , breakfast buffet expensive for some cold eggs and french toast burned . Night staff a lady and gentlemen very helpful with recomendations to great places and things to do. Would go back , but only because I was greeted good and because staff at reception were helpful

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - YOU WILL REGRET IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedGuest1
Reviews.Content: My whole family were looking forward to this vacation and expected to have an above average stay in the hotel. Montreal is great but this hotel is lousy. The rooms are small and had a foul smell. It was already very late in the evening but I had to buy an air freshener to be able to sleep in the room. We have to change the room they initially assigned to us because it e was too hot as the AC was not working. The new room we got was 10% better in terms of the AC which is not much and the smell as bad as the first one.. You can even smell it from the pillows. The rooms have a card that you can fill in to report any maintenance request that you have. I requested for them to plug the floor lamps as the available socket is right behind the TV/ TV stand (very heavy) and the lighting system in the room is in adequate. I also requested for them to adjust the AC to cooler settings or fix it if it is not working properly but there seems to be no action taken nor an acknowledgement of our request. How do I know? After my 4 days stay the floor lamp is till unplugged and the AC as worse. I wonder why do they put a lamp when they do not have plug it ???!!!!! It was very frustrating as the room was dark once night sets in - really dark as in I am unable to organized my suitcase and had to wait until the next day when light sets in to make the room brighter. The only positive thing is the service of the reception staff named Gloria who was helpful, efficient and knowledgeable in giving recommendations on where to eat. Her suggestions were truly great restaurants with very good food and good prices. The price I paid for this hotel is not what you would call cheap so I was really disappointed. On the last day, I asked them to please call me a taxi to get to the train station and it never came. We waited for 10 minutes until we just can't wait anymore. We just went outside ourselves and flagged a taxi which we were able to get less than a minute. Such terrible service. Next time, I will not be fooled by the beautiful photos on the internet of hotels/ motels such as this property. Remember - you can only be fooled once. I should have considered all the bad reviews posted by past guests because they were all indeed correct. :( :(

Reviews.Title: “Great place-solid value”
Reviews.Author: kmunger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The place looks really dated on the outside but don't let appearances fool you, it's much nicer inside. The room was small but very functional and clean. The location is very good; steps away from the metro. The personell was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a weekend in Montreal on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: laadams
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went for the July 4th weekend, which was also during the Jazz Festival. This place had all we needed... not chic-chic but fine for our needs. Clean rooms, located two blocks from the Guy-Concordia Metro... lots of cheap eats in the area. A block from St Catherine street shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Haiku77
Reviews.Content: If you plan to go to Montreal, I definitely recommend Hotel Maritime Plaza!! I stayed 1 night to join the Jazz festival. When I booked this hotel, I was worried little bit because of hotel review... but they showed us great hospitality, comfortable and clean room!! I am sure to spend this hotel again to enjoy my vacation!! Hope you spend great night tooâ™ªâ™ª

Reviews.Title: “Motel quality and really bad service. NOT GOOD for family.”
Reviews.Author: esthersk
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for two nights via Priceline.com. When we booked, we mentioned that there are two adults and one teenager and one toddler. What we got is one small room with only one bed. Talked to the reception lady to get a different room with two beds. She said she didn't have any. We asked if we could upgrade the room. She said she had a junior suite (one king bed with a sofa bed) and she charged me with a really unreasonable price (which I could get a 4 or up star hotel). Since it was already late, and our kids were tired after travelled long hours, we had to stay with no option. When we asked for a refrigerator and a microwave, they charged me $15 extra each on top of the room fee we paid. The parking is really expensive. The parking lot is small, not enough space to park and manuver. The elevator is really slow. Bottom line is DO NOT STAY IN THIS 'HOTEL' (they should change their name to Motel).

Reviews.Title: “Digusting Experience”
Reviews.Author: LarsCharlottetown
Reviews.Content: Very dirty hotel. Excrement all over bathroom. Beds smell disgusting. Could not sleep because the scent was horrid. Asked for service, they agreed but did nothing about it. Several members of my group rented other rooms, all had the same disgusting experience

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, central but a 'violent' shower!”
Reviews.Author: Dr3w
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, conveniently situated near the main shopping area of Rue Sainte-Catherine and the city's subway system. The rooms are clean and tidy, we had a double double, and the bathroom was very nice (even though the shower was the most "violent" I have ever experienced!). Other people on our trip told us that the hotel's restaurant was very good, reasonably priced with good food. Pretty much used this as somewhere to rest our heads at the end of each day! We were travelling as part of a coach party on a tour of New England and Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Somsco
Reviews.Content: Traveled with parents and spouse - stayed there for 3 days. Booked through the secret hotel option on an online travel site - so got a better deal than the normal going rate for the hotel. Location is very good - downtown Montreal, minutes walk from the shopping area / underground complexes, 2 subway stations, half hour walk from the tourist areas (cathedral / imax / speedboat) Reasonable dining experience (15-20$ per head - we are vegetarians) - a buffet breakfast option for 12-14$ was also available (which is a good way to go considering nothing is open around the downtown area at 9am on a weekend) Parking available at the hotel for a nominal fee Had some issues with the room (faulty bulb, non working safe) which was rectified as soon as we lodged a complaint Our room had 2 double beds, flat screen tv, coffeemaker etc. We spent only the nights in - were out the whole day exploring Montreal - so the location / room / comfort / amenities suited our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great for younger crowds”
Reviews.Author: aloiseau10
Reviews.Content: A few friends and me got two rooms here for a graduation trip, and none of us could really complain about anything. All of the staff was very friendly and helped us plan a great night of fun out in the city. The suite we got was perfect sized for the amount of people we were accommodating in it (5) and had a stove, fridge, microwave, living room with two couches and some chairs, spacious bathroom and a seperated bedroom. The other room we got was a normal room and seemed very clean. Everything we wanted to do was within walking distance of the hotel and anything else was just a short cab ride away. Both rooms were very affordable. Although it's not the most elegant or classy hotel, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking to have a great time in the city and if we ever came back up to Canada, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: rina1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and booked through priceline. I've heard priceline customers get the worst rooms, but the room I got was nowhere near a 3* room. The room got bright by 7am, the air conditioning barely provided any cool air, there was no control from the room, and the bed came with heavy duvets, so quality of sleep was terrible. Elevators were ridiculously slow, and our room keys were deactivated. After wasting 10 minutes going up and coming down when I needed to use the bathroom the front desk worker was rude about it, and asked me why I didn't just use the other key. If I had the second key would I waste my time coming down?? No apology, he just gave me a new key. Complaints about the brightness and temperature did nothing, the complaints weren't even addressed. There was no remote in the room, had to call down to front desk to get one. Internet access code changed virutally every other day with no notice. Calls to front desk would go unanswered so in the middle of using the internet we would just get disconnected. Only two bath towels in the bathroom which was annoying. Carpet in the room was filthy with stains. Windows did not have a screen, so if you kept the window open to make the room less stuffy bugs would come in. At best a 2* hotel. Complaints to priceline are still unresolved, should have checked out after the first night, but after spending upwards of $500 and no chance for a refund we put up with it and barely spent time in our room, and changed our routine around to be up by 7. Location was fantastic, but other than that, no real positives about this place. Would definitely not return, and makes me weary to book a hotel without knowing what I'm getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SealoverQuebec
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days last week with my boyfriend who was attending a conference. Rooms are nice and kept relatively clean. Of course, you're downtown so expect to hear some city noises like ambulances, fire trucks and plain traffic around the clock. But you get used to it, don't worry. What you don't get used to is 4 girls partying in there room with the door open. I usually read people saying that French Canadians are always troubling there little peace and quiet. I am French Canadian and those girls were English Canadians, thank you very much. It rained one day and I spent it in the indoor pool and gym. The gym is tiny, but the pool is wonderful, with a nice outside and private terrace for sunny days. The elevator broke a few times during my stay. Once when I was in it and it was not very funny... got hot very quickly in there. It took about 15 minutes before someone could help us. I only had breakfast there and it is very expensive for a buffet style meal. Service is top notch though. There is an indoor and private parking, which is great. Enjoy Montreal and if you stay at the Maritime Plaza and like Indian food, you must have dinner at the Maharaja, almost next door. Indian buffet and everything is absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Good and reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: fabcanada78
Reviews.Content: I spent almost 10 nights there since 6 months. It is not a brand new hotel but completely updated and it is very clean, the service is great, nice swimming pool, location near the Bell centre (for Canadiens fan) and not too far from the Subway. I like to stay there, downtown, for business more than outside of the city and keeping my expenses low. You can find good rates on internet. Just be careful, the parking is extra ($15.00) and the breakfast is good but not included ($10.00 extra). Ok it is not the best but still in Montreal, it is a good middle range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, definitely going to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: justin009
Reviews.Content: I was very comfortable and found the location to be extremely convenient. The room was beautiful and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird70
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and love it. It is very comfortable, clean and the staff is very efficient and friendly; the price is also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sun044
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and booked using Hotwire. When we got to the hotel, we hoped to get our room, leave our suitcases, and go back out and explore the city. When we got to the front desk, the clerk could not find our reservations, even thought we had booked a week in advance. After about 20 minutes, he found it. He said the hotel never received the email from Hotwire telling them about our reservation... On to the room. The plastic credit card mechanism always had to be jiggled to get the green light to open the door. There was no remote control and we had to ask for one. The toilet paper had no roller. The next morning, I picked up the iron, and it was awful, there was no teflon left on the bottom, and it looked kind of old. It did not work anyway, and they replaced it with a nice new iron when we went out. The furniture looks pretty on the website, but I found it scratched and dented in places. The beds were comfortable, the sheets were fine, there were nice toiletries in the bathroom. The shower was hard to adjust and the water pooled at the bottom. The last night we were both woken up by people talking in the middle of the night. The pool was a nice size and warm. You have to ask for a towel at the front desk, there are no towels at the pool. The hotel people had pleasant personalities and did their best to serve us. The internet worked. The location is 2 blocks from the Metro station which is excellent. I have had better experiences in other hotels in Montreal, and I think there is room for improvement at this one. It's a three star.

Reviews.Title: “love montreal and this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fantunes
Reviews.Content: very good location and very confortable room,... nothing to say,...

Reviews.Title: “great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Elisabetd
Reviews.Content: We landed this Hotel with Travelocity Top Secret, and it worked out very well. We had 2 double beds, very quiet room, friendly staff, we have abig car, and the parking ramp was tied. The attendent came and parked for us, and also brought it up. The in and out ramp is the same and that is strange. The pool was the nicest we had on this trip, warm, deep enough, and big enough and a deck to overlook the street. A nice Indian Buffet next door,avoid the Dominos Pizza. We did not try the hotel restaurant, it looked very nice. Close to the Bell Centre and a big Habs game was going on, best to get to the room fast after the concert that night. Shopping is close by, did not shop much. Some grocery stores left on St. Catherine, if some items are needed. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price of admission...”
Reviews.Author: DMBFan77
Reviews.Content: For less than $100.00 it was prettty much what I expected. I liked that you could open a window. The location was perfect for what I needed... somewhere close to the Bell Center. Lot's of things to do around the hotel as well ie: restaurants and shops. I could go on and on about the little things that are not to be expected when paying for more but I didn't pay for more so I can't really complain about anything. Would I return again? Yes if I was by myself or with a bunch of buddies. Would I take my wife? Are you kidding? My wife deserves better... as in I'll fork over the extra $100 and find a place that has that extra star. I really don't have anything bad to say. Tip: Parking is ok but don't show up with a huge SUV cause you are not going to make it inside. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, nice rooms - but don't expect great service”
Reviews.Author: BlondElvis
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location was great. Price was right. Room was nice. Cons: Service was generally poor. Check-in took 30 minutes with a huge line-up with only 1 person working front desk. Breakfast was expensive for what you got. Restaurant manager was unfriendly and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albert394
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was outstanding, just one block away from St. Catherine's street. I would certainly without hesitation stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: danielle181977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb. of 09 for three nights with my 10 year old son. Location was great. within walking distance to subway, restauraunts and bell center... Price was great. Pool was great. Staff was very helpfull. Only complaint is that no breakfast included. Planning another stay in May of 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, no bigger errors to complain about”
Reviews.Author: evafoi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite big, is bit unpersonal and there is no special athmosphere. The service is okay. It has also a swimmingpool, which we did not try out. The breakfast is unfortunately not included in the roomprice. The location of the hotel is good as it is in a walking distance to the modern town center. The rooms are okay, not too big and not too small, not noisy, clean. The beds are comfortable and there is a huge tv-programm-collection for whomever it might ever play a role while staying in MontrÃ©al. There is also a free internet access in all rooms. The bathrooms are okay, not too big and not too small either. Although we stayed here in january while the outside temperatures were about minus 20 to 30 Â° Celsius the rooms were warm and you could regulate the room temperature by a thermostat which is attached at the wall. All in all: a usefull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and uncomfortable but centrally located and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: dandywilber
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in Montreal around the same price range, yet this was by far the least comfortable. The room we stayed in was very cold, even with the heat turned up all the way. The carpet and bathroom were both dirty. The tub filled up while running the shower for more than 5 minutes, and the non-adjustable water pressure was painful to stand in. The bed was rock-hard. The only good things about the hotel were the location (very close to Ste Catherine and shopping) and that it was quiet (though, this may have been because of the time of year we were visiting). I will not stay here again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Robbinn
Reviews.Content: As someone mentioned earlier, the pictures were very deceiving. It was not worth the price, and Days Inn-Centre Ville, on the other side of the town, was whole lot better in cleanliness and service. I would not recommend this place to any one. Just not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Location-wise, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Deejaysee
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel, concluding my tour of eatern Canada. My room was on the tenth floor, hence my slight anxiety about an escape route in the event of fire - only one central staircase. Room was comfortable, although difficult to control the temperature - either too hot, or too chilly. Being able to open the window a couple of inches provided much needed fresh air. The provision of a bath robe was a nice touch. There is a swimming pool on the second floor which looked inviting. Breakfast, if I remember correctly, was something like $Can 15 for a rather tired buffet breakfast. I did not go back - there were better cheaper options elsewhere. The location is excellent with many places within walking distance, and an efficient underground system ($Can 17 for a 3 day tourist ticket) which takes you to the Olympic Stadium, and the impressive St Joseph's Oratory. Old Montreal reminded me of Paris or Quebec, and downtown Montreal is a kind of French New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lotzasmiles
Reviews.Content: At $99/night, this hotel was a bargain for us because it was in a great location. It put us right within walking distance of St. Catherine Steet (the primary commercial artery of downtown Montreal). We planned on enjoying the Montreal nightlife and to not spend too much time in the hotel. If I was planning on spending more time at the hotel I would have chose somewhere else. It isn't as nice as it looks on the website. It's getting run down and the furniture and bedsheets all look very used. The washroom didn't look like a modern hotel washroom - it looked more like something you'd find in an old house. But you really can't beat the location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get to know MontrÃ©al!”
Reviews.Author: Anomisimona
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of MontrÃ©al it is a great hotel to do Sightseeing and shopping. The staff was really nice and we could move to our room extremly early, altough we did not anounce our arrive at 10:00 AM. On their website we found a very cheap price - check there. The fries were really good and breakfast was more than fine, there the only thing was, that the difference between continental and american buffet was no clear.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4 STAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: lerkinx7
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel as it's advertised. Maybe a 3. Service was so so, not very helpful Desk clerks. Had breakfast buffet once, very bad and expensive. The people atmosphere was very iffy. M y suggestion, don't be greedy, spend a little more money and get better!

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: erinm423
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was pretty bad. It is NOTHING like the picture. In my opinion, it was equal to staying at a motel. The bedding was cheap and the showers flooded. I was really disappointed. The rates are not bad and I wouldn't mind but the pictures the provide are totally deceiving.... They make the rooms look much nicer than they are. Plus, our view looked over all this junk ... it was just utterly disappointing. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good food”
Reviews.Author: Management_and_team
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the good service during our AGM, coffee breaks where very well presented and the food at the Restaurant was great !

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bennetttravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and staff relatively friendly. The walls are very thin and you can hear you neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: BSO2
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of two nights at this location. I was in Montreal for the nightlife. This hotel was relativley inexpensive and a 10 minute walk to all the bars and shopping on sherbrooke, rene levesque or crescent. The hotel rooms really need to be updated unless you are into the 80s type style. The front desk was polite and courtious even when a friend of mine lost his key card twice in the course of the night. Location is everything with this hotel, it is very close to all the major clubs and shopping and very cheaply priced for downtown montreal. it is also right beside Buffet Maharajaâ€Ž which is a great east indian buffet restraunt, one of the best I have been to yet.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: mukul22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Maritme Plaze for 28 days for business reason. The best thing about the Hotel is it's prime location. a block away from St Catherine St, one of the most happening place in Montreal. Companies like IBM, CSC, CGI across the Road, Metro station nearby......What more....everything was good, except the price, they charged me $125 per day for 28 days....They should have given me a better deal........

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: LMargaret W
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the misfortune to have stayed here, while on a tour of the USA and Canada. We arrived to find a rather horrid little man guiding the lengthy queue for the lifts. When we got to our room it appeared okay. However, on closer inspection, the carpets were stained, as were the chairs. The bed was clean and comfortable but the bathroom was another matter. The bathroom was tiny, the basin was dirty were it was chipped and it had burn marks on. I took one look at the shower and decided not to bother. It just had this all over grubby feel about it. I did ask if we could be moved but was told all the rooms were taken, so we had no choice but to stay put. The hotel is located in an unpleasant area, with quite alot of graffiti around. We couldn't wait to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One night at Maritime”
Reviews.Author: SightSeersWithDog
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean room on 5th floor overlooking car park at back, hence also quiet. Very small bathroom. Some people, on same tour as, us had rooms at front and windows open due to being too hot. They found it a bit too noisy. Very pleasant front desk staff. Although the room was clean, I believe I was bitten by bed bugs. I reported this to the hotel and they replied, with apologies, saying they would look into it. Can't comment on hotel value as it was part of a package.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TRivington
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maritime while in town to watch the Montreal Canadiens play. Room was very clean, close to the Bell Centre, room was small but I was there for the game at not for the stay at the hotel. If you want a decent place to stay and don't want to spend a ton of money, this is a good place. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location-hotel is perfect for a few day stay”
Reviews.Author: edsullivan
Reviews.Content: You probably will not find a better priced hotel in this location. Hotel has everything that you would want for a short stay. Woman cleaning rooms on 7th fl was great,she made everyone feel at home-not often do you run into such a friendly helpful worker-bar tender and restaurant staff also nice. Front desk staff could take a lesson from the rest,not always friendly-a smile and hello would be nice-never happened at arrival or check out Overall-nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: trev71
Reviews.Content: Actually we have stayed at this hotel every year for the last 9 years.. We go up to see two NHL games every year during Super Bowl Weekend.. The rooms are clean, and neat.. They got a great pool i dont really know what more you can ask for.. You are in Downtown Montreal, close to the Bell Centre... honnestly for the amount of time your in this room, its worth it and then some..

Reviews.Title: “good location but quality of rooms lacking...”
Reviews.Author: tman2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently love the location right near everything, but the quality of the thin walls from previous reviews wasn't lying...! Everytime someone slammed there door in the hallway i thought the were in my room if your not used to noise don't stay here! The location rocks it quite good....

Reviews.Title: “NIce room, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: bignickel
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very clean and charming. Good downtown location. My only complaint would be that the walls are quite thin and I could hear everything happening in the neighbouring room. Also, there was no bathroom fan that I could turn on to drown out the noise. I am going to try another downtown hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: norton_lees
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read in some other reviews that this is supposed to be a four star, 'cos it don't feel like it. The gripes were the bathroom sink tap didn't work, reported when I discovered it, as this was a sunday evening I didn't expect it to be sorted out immediately, but it still wasn't sorted when I checked out on wednesday, so teeth were cleaned using the bath taps, or while in the shower. My room was next to one of the laundry rooms, so it could be quite noisy from early in the morning. The cleaning staff didn't seem to dust or vacuum my room, just make the bed and replace towels, which seems a bit much, not that it was dirty, I just noticed. The good things are the location, easy walk to shopping areas and the metro. My room was large, and bed gave me the best nights of sleep of my whole holiday, had the breakfast one morning and it was fine, but I agree with the previous posters comment about tipping, it seems a little rich expecting a tip for poring two cups of coffee. I wouldn't break my neck to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrotaMonde
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean and nicely furnished room, some good restaurants close by. There's a computer in the lobby where we could check our emails free of charge, and there's an in-house restaurant with a nice breakfast buffet. Friendly tri-lingual staff in the front desk (En/Fr/Sp). The only problem I found was the street noise since it's at the corner of two important streets.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4star as advertised outside hotel but a reasonable 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Anthony06
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel in a fairly good location. It is just off St. Catherine street and you get the main shops in about 10 mins walk. It is about a 3-5 min walk to nearest metro stop. Hotel says it is a 4 star but a long way from that. Bar was closed at 10.30, room service food at same time. Hotel is in need of refurbishment. Room was very big, bed was fairly comfortable but a bit dated. However it was clean. I think this is a decent 3 star standard hotel rather than anything more. It is clean and in a good location and if you get a good price it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Our experience started off bad as our room wasn't ready for us to check into. The staff told us to come back at a specific time to check in, so we left the hotel to walk around downtown (the one redeeming quality was that it was close to the downtown area). Upon our return to check in our room still wasn't ready. After hours of waiting we finally got our room and were disgusted by the stains on the carpet and even on the pillow cases! On the second night of our stay a nice couple attempted to open the door to our room as the staff had assigned them to our room as well! Nothing about this hotel was as it seemed online. The gym consisted of a closet sized room with a treadmill, bike and getto stepper that were all so close to each other it was uncomfortable. I could go on, but I digress... only stay at this hotel if you can't afford to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged / deceived prices”
Reviews.Author: mmorrell
Reviews.Content: Was quoted $80 a night - when checked out, was charged $180 plus $30 for two cars, when I only had one. They refused to back out the extra catr charge and were very rude. The room was nice, but the experience dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel and enjoyed it. The room was clean and comfortable. The decor a little dated - but nothing that concerned us. If you are looking for a modern hotel however, this would not suit. Free internet is always a bonus. The location was fantastic. I was concerned that we would be too far from the downtown but only one street back from St Catherines which was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: kirakira
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. I have two boys who had a wonderful time at the pool at the end of every day. I used the little gym a few times. It was tiny but all the equipment worked fine. The room was clean and the air con worked wonderfully and the beds were comfortable. The elevators were a little slow so we sometimes used the stairs. The breakfast was really great! Especially if you have kids. They had a huge selection of items, from eggs, bacon and sausage, to yogurt, cereal, fruits, and let's not forget the mini croissants! The front desk folks were very kind. The rest of the staff were a little distant, but professional. The location is excellent if you are a business person. For a family on vacation it's fine if you love to walk and take the subway. We booked with AAA so our parking was free so we drove around a bit. (small car is a must for their parking garage). I would have liked more and better towels all around. But that was minor. In general I would recommend and re-visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: CEOtravels
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Montreal for a party weekend. Age range of our group was 21-25. We originally booked an Executive deluxe suite (2 queen beds and a sofa bed) and another standard room (2 queen beds). When we arrived to the hotel, we found out that they didn't give us an executive suite, but just an executive room (2 queen beds) on the executive floors. Let me just say, this room was a complete rip off. The standard room that I booked was more spacious than the executive room. The hotel management wasn't that helpful either compared to the other hotels that I have been to. Their "take it or leave it" attitude was just completely disrespectful. At the end of the trip, we were taking our car out of their garage and found out that we had to also pay a parking fee. Please keep in mind that we had already checked out and paid for our rooms. Went to pay for the parking fee which amounted to approx. USD 15-16 per night. This was by far just adding insult to injury. If you have to stay at this hotel, I would suggest getting a standard room to be safe. Otherwise, check other hotels in the area. I am sure the Marriott would offer you complimentary parking and a much better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hari_yogi
Reviews.Content: We have choosen this hotel because we expected a good quality due to the 4 stars. Our first impression after arriving there was good. The room was clean and the staff friendly. The hotel is situated well. The shock came during the first night: it has been unacceptable noisy. We have slept there 3 nights and just in one we got really sleep. And we were not disturbed by direct neighbours but by guests from other floors. It seems that this hotel is a popular adress for especially young people that come from all over North America to visit Montreal and to enjoy first the night live of this amazing city and to continue afterwards at this hotel. The responsible duty manager was not available and so we had to accept other peoples parties during the night for 99$ a night and an average sleeping time of 3-4 hours per night. Conclusion: for people searching for rest during the night this hotel is a disaster. For youngsters that look for party and get to know other young people it seems to be a good adress.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal's best kept secret.”
Reviews.Author: soundguy27
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all these negative reviews. Went to Montreal for fun with friends. This hotel was in my price range and was spotless. Lobby and rooms were first class. Great location for downtown walking about. Secure underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: punkindrublic
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple so we took a room with one bed. The bed was very large and the room was spotless and very clean. Very big windows and a balcony. However the balcony is 100% concrete and the only recommendation I would have is to make the balcony more presentable (something more than just concrete floor and walls). The bathroom was very nice as well and the water pressure was fine. I would definately stay there again. The price is competitive for the quality : not cheap but not too expensive either. Service was fine as far as we could tell but we didn't require much from them because we had all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Was it the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Sheepish239
Reviews.Content: I just had to check before I wrote this that I had got the right hotel. We stayed for 3 nights with a tour and found the hotel to be really pleasant. The room was large and very clean. We ate in the restaurant one night when we got back late and that was good value and the breakfast buffet was lovely and fresh and plentiful. I used the business centre to send/check emails and that was free of charge with very little waiting time. The location was great just a short walk away from the main shopping street. The little shop was so handy and open quite long hours I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Website very misleading”
Reviews.Author: elfy10
Reviews.Content: Three stars at best. I arrived at 4pm and the room wasn't ready, staff in parking extremely rude, parking expensive for Montreal. 10$ a day for Internet in 2007? It was cheaper than that when I went at my elementary school on the first Pentiums. My room was the only one with no newspaper in the morning, and the "fitness facility" they advertise is comprised of a threadmill and exercise bike that are older than my mother thrown in a cramped room smaller than my walk-in wardrobe with no air circulation. Very disappointing! Will not return. Only pluses I can think of is the hotel is two subway stations away from the shopping district and easy access to A-20.

Reviews.Title: “Good location slow service”
Reviews.Author: tamfoxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night OK position easy to walk to the waterfront which is nice or Mount Royal which is strenuous but well worth it for the views.Bed rooms were OK and certainly not as bad as some of the reviews

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel017
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel recently. i agree that the website does make this hotel look much better than it is. the room we stayed in was ok not what i was expecting. When we checked in we did not have any problems our room was ready for us. there was a very helpful man at the front desk who gave us suggestions on things to do and see. so pretty much this is an average looking hotel with good front desk service. not a place to stay for a romantic getaway, as the hotel doesn't have much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: bennad
Reviews.Content: Beware- the hotel's website makes this place look pretty nice, and it rates between 3 and 4 stars. if the dirty, vinyl curtains don't deter you, the not so friendly staff might. The only plus is the location, which is just a block or so away from Rue St. Catherine, a heralded shopping strip. I didn't go anywhere near the shopping, and I'm not so sure that the hotel is located anywhere near the shopping anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star?! No Way! Three Star? Doubtful.”
Reviews.Author: niftyc
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to see a four-star certification on the hotel's web page! This is a hotel in disrepair. Some areas have been recently renovated with a shiny new veneer, but the underlying shabbiness shows through. My room was well-decorated, but with a dank smell. The aged electronic key card demagnetized after every single use, forcing many trips on the extremely slow elevator (one of which was always out of order). On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. Instead of a bellhop, they lead you to a dingy backroom where you can deposit your own bag. The wireless Internet was blazing fast (and $10/day), but the front desk staff seemed unfamiliar with selling it, and they finally had to call me back before they could give me a password. The wallpaper and lighting was new in some areas, but the carpets were worn and stained. There were many missing hangars in the closet, and the iron in my room was broken when i tried to use it. The immediate location is a treeless highway off-ramp, but it is an easy walk to St. Catherine Street were there are a variety of businesses. My overall impression is that this hotel is uneven.

Reviews.Title: “Bette than expected - Formula 1 Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bruceeboy
Reviews.Content: The Maritime Plaza was one of the few notable hotels near Rue St Catherines with available rooms when I made my reservations almost 6 months prior to the F1 race. From the reviews, I was expecting the worst, but was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, the staff (desk & housekeeping) very friendly, in spite of the hectic weekend. Location was superb - easy walk to the subway and activities in the city. I was also probably unnecessariy concerned about where I would be leaving my car and again pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel garage was very secure - i.e .fully closed off to the public. Considering how busy they were, I did fret over whether or not the linen & towels would be attended to, but once again, not a worry. The only negatives (1) street noise the night before the race was quite noticeable, waking me several times and (2) the "European-like air conditioning" just barely kept the room cool. If I return next year, I might try another location, but certainly wouldn't be dissappointed if I stayed at the Maritime.

Reviews.Title: “Happy enough”
Reviews.Author: StapletonSteve
Reviews.Content: Have to say I am quite surprised by a lot of the negative reviews for this place. Maybe they have done something about it since? Stayed for 3 nights in May 2007 and had no problems. Room was good size with 2 large beds, decent decor, furniture and clean. All of the usual facilities I would expect, coffee maker, ironing board, hair drier. Bathroom clean and everything working OK. No issues with staff. Most importantly had 3 good nights sleep which is rare in a hotel these days. Good buffet breakfast with hot or cold choice. Only niggle I might have is that you are on the edge of the city centre and it is a bit of a trek to the old part of Montreal and the waterfront but maybe that is why it was quiet - take your choice. Bar looked a bit cheesy but there are some excellent bars, pubs and restaurants nearby. If I return to Montreal I would look no further than this place for accommodation

Reviews.Title: “never to return”
Reviews.Author: gmgranola
Reviews.Content: We live in Northern Vermont, about an hour from Montreal and decided to go for a few nights at the last minute. I called to make the reservation because it was for that same evening plus 2 more evenings. The clerk told me if I booked online I would pay $119 but if I booked on the phone, it would be $159. I asked her if this was the case even though I wanted to come that very night. She said yes. So I booked online with my credit card. In 2 hours we were at the desk trying to check in. They had no record of our reservation and instead of just booking us in and getting us to our room, they had us stand there for 30 minutes while they scolded one another and looked at the computer. They finally gave us our keys (I've no idea if they ever found our reservation) Our room was on the 11th floor and we waited FOREVER for the elevator. We finally got to the room and neither key worked. My husband went back downstairs while I sat in the hallway with our luggage. It took him almost 45 minutes to return. The room was okay. Stuffy and the bed looked comfy enough but it was like sleeping on cardboard with a pad on top. That might we woke about 3 in the morning SWELTERING hot. The A/C was clearly broken. I called down to the desk and the clerk actually said, "Well you are the only one complaining." It was July. The A/C didn't get fixed until the next night and there was never a mention of it by the staff. There were other negative aspects...enough to make us not want to return. In 20 years in the innkeeping business, I believe that hospitality makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever In Montreal”
Reviews.Author: icialex
Reviews.Content: I'm travelling often to Montreal and it's one of the worst booked to Montreal. Very rude staff, restaurant close, and we've been stock in the elevator for more than an hour. although, the room is nice but NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL... Days Inn is better for the price.....

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: GWesley
Reviews.Content: while the beds are nice and it is clean....the staff are terrible. I was stuck in an elevator for three hours at this hotel. the alarm and the phone were broken. it took over an hour for a staff member to hear us. she assured us she was going to go and get help. 45 minutes later a second person discovered us (we had resumed yelling at this point because the first person hadnt come back) He said that she had left her shift and hadnt reported the incident. he said he would go get help. we asked that he kindly check in every 10 or so minutes because we were kinda scared and wanted to know what was going on. this man did go get help, but it took over an hour and he never checked back in. infact we didnt even know that the mechanic was there. all of a sudden the elevator lurched and we fell over 8 stories, stopping abruptly on the second floor. we all thought that we were going to die (there were 3 in the elevator). No one ever appoligised to us. we tried to talk to the staff to tell them about the broken phone and alarm but they kept ignoring us and talking to the manager in french instead. it was a terrible experiance. I realize that elevators are faulty, but the way they delt with the situation was unforgivable. If you have any other questions about the hotel feel free to email me wesley_614@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: LindsToronto
Reviews.Content: Was totally not what I expected. Booked through Hotels.ca, looked like a nice place but it wasn't., Staff was very rude and not helpful. Parking is 15$ a night..I would have rather paid the extra money to a better hotel with free parking. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on location and price but after reading some of the reviews was worried that I would be staying at a dive. I was quite pleasantly surprised. The room looked just like the photo on the website and although the hotel was very busy the staff was helpful, the restaurant was good, the pool a plus and the exercise room adequate, although small. I was attending the Montreal Jazzfest and the location was perfect whether I wanted to walk 15-20 minutes to the venue or take the Metro a block away from the hotel. There was good shopping and several 24 hour coffee shops in the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels we ever stayed in, the hotel does not look like the picture and only the lobby is really clean, we had to stay a week and the sheets weren't changed in a week , you have to call them for everything coffee & coffee condiments, sink didn't drain, blow dryer didn't work, bath tub would have the same hair in it daily after the room was apparently cleaned. Vending machines for soft drinks were empty for our entire stay. Housekeepers are rude and get even ruder if you ask them for anything they might have forgotten. Housekeepers were found two differant times sitting on beds that were occupied when the people were gone out when in fact they should have been cleaning the rooms. the carpets are not vaccumed in your room during your stay there was toe nail clippings by the bed that remained there for the week. In a week the restuarant they advertise was only open three times, they didn't have set hours and you could never plan to have to arrange a meal, so you had to walk somewhere else to eat and there isn't a good place to eat for at least two blocks or more. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone that has to stay in it for more than one night! I do not believe this hotel ranks a three star rating it should be lowered to at least a two star. This hotel's location is not in a good area for a family it is right on the line of a lower class area of city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, but management?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on tour..........48 guests........were supposed to be able to check in by 4pm.......rather late check-in for a hotel I think. However, even though it was after 4pm when we arrived we were made to wait out on the pavement for about 1/2 an hour until they were ready for us! They should at least have let us into the lobby. But once in the room it was great, huge room, great shower, comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: rayjay12002
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and a great value. I have read other reviews which indicated that they would never go there again and it was a terrible experience. I thought it was fine. The people at the front desk were helpfull and polite. Yes, the bathroom was a little small, but it was clean and everything worked fine. I had a non-smoking room, but it was either very close to a smoking room or previously a smoking room. We did not use the pool or go to the restaraunt, so I cannot comment on those aspects. It was very convenient to have the parking at the hote which was $15 / day.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a hostel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room itself was okay, the hotel is definitively not the four-star it is rated. Other weekend guests were drinking, smoking, fighting and shouting, even shattering mirrors on our floor. The management was helpless, indifferent at best, and did not care to offer any explanation, solution or compensation. We strongly recommend against staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling of Dishonesty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and 11 year old son spent the night in this hotel on Feb 18. For the money paid for the night, there is nothing exceptional about the hotel, nothing more than one expects. A very unfortunate incident happened though. My son left his bag of stuff in the room including ipod, gameboy, lego, etc. He knew exactly where he left it - on the floor, half under the bed, by the window. In a matter of 3 days incl that very night, I had spoken to front desk, head of housekeeping, and deputy manager. The General Manager never returned my call. In brief, they claim that nothing was left behind and that nobody else occupied the room after us. Hmmmm. Makes you wonder doesnt it? Much as cleanliness, service, friendliness of staff are important, I think it is as equally or more important to feel that you can trust anybody that works in that hotel - after all, it is home away from home. I just feel that the way they handled our situation was very inept. Instead of pacifying us, we felt more angry and cheated and lied to. Know for sure, we will never return to this hotel or recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spend a weekend in Montreal -- at the Maritime. I've been to Montreal several tiems, but wanted to stay a new place. I based booking this hotel on some of the feedback I found on this site...as such...I felt the need to add my review...so that others will have a REAL sense of this hotel. Our room was comfortable, clean and very satisfactory. The bathroom was nice, but a bit small. It did have a big king bed which was great. Location was average at best. You are near St. Catherine Street, but you're at the far west end...so its a hike to get to the main shopping area. And you're on the boarder with the "rougher side of town". Decor was much like any 2 or 3 star I might have stayed in as a college student roaming around Europe and Greece...meaning...forget the 4 star rating...its a 3 star at best. The bar area and lounge...looked like something out of a 70s slasher movie...seedy all the way. Value...look, I'll tell you straight...If you need a place to stay that is cheap and near downtown...its fine,basic...stay there. If you need a nice place for a romantic get-away or if you've been to the city before...spend $25 more a night and stay at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great value at discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: robshahome
Reviews.Content: Our experience here has been great! The room was clean, well appointed and extremely comfortable (love the overstuffed pillows and bed spread). The bathroom is small but clean and well furnished and decorated. Restaurant was expensive so didn't try. Got a good deal on the room but parking and internet access were extra. We had an "executive" room. Right next to St. Catherine's street where all the restaurants and stores are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltravels
Reviews.Content: For the price and location ($100US), this place was great. The service was good, clean, nice rooms, queen anne style furniture, one of the most luxurious mattress and pillows i've ever slept on! The pool was decent, nothing special, lobby was average, reasonable paid parking in the basement, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Here's Another Plus for this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barleycove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at this hotel at the end of January 2005. We reserved through the internet and the rates were reasonable, about $100 Can. per night. Our room was comfortable, clean and very satisfactory. The hotel location is ideal; we could walk to most places downtown and the Metro is just a block away. By Metro, you can easily reach anywhere in the city. We ate all our breakfasts at the hotel restaurant, Le Beau Rivage. It was a hot and cold buffet, very satisfactory. We also ate two dinners there and were pleased with both. The staff were polite and helpful. In all, our holiday in Montreal was great, and we recommend the Maritime Plaza to others.

Reviews.Title: “Setting the record straight”
Reviews.Author: redmeadows
Reviews.Content: After having read all the other reviews, I feel the need to share my experience at the Maritime Plaza with you. I stayed there with my boyfriend in mid-November 2004 for 3 nights. We booked directly through the hotel's own website, and paid $95 Can. plus tax per night. Indoor parking was available for $11 Can. plus tax, which I must add is a very reasonable price to pay for hotel parking in Montreal. Space is at a premium here, and I have searched high and low for cheap hotel parking charges, and this is the cheapest I can find. So those people who complain about having it being too expensive have obviously not looked around. I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised by the amenities in the hotel at this price. We had a room with a queen-sized bed, with down duvet and pillows (lots of them), a cotton bath robe free of charge (unless you want to take it home with you), Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries (in generous-sized containers), and lots of space in the room and windows the width of one whole long wall. The bathroom is a little bit small, but is in line with most other hotels in Montreal that I have stayed in. It is also clean. The sheets were definitely not stained, and they have a policy not to change the sheets every day if you are staying for more than one night in order to be more environmentally friendly. Frankly, why would we expect the hotel to change our sheets every day when we don't do that at our own home? But they will change them if you tell them to. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and professional. I wouldn't say they were really chummy, but you don't go to a hotel to make new friends with the staff anyway. They were efficient and polite. What more should we ask for? They were also bilingual. My boyfriend is francophone and I am an anglo, and the person at the desk switched between English and French fluently and willingly. We didn't use the pool or the exercise equipment because we didn't have time even though we would have liked to because the pool looked very inviting. The hotel is in such a good location that we spent most of our waking time out on the streets, shopping, taking in the sites and enjoying the restaurants. It's only a block from rue Ste. Catherine, the main shopping street downtown. It's got tons of good restaurants and neat shops, and we didn't mind the walk at all. In fact this hotel is in a particularly good location because it is kind of at one end of the shopping stretch so we could just start at the hotel and went east, do the whole strip, and come back and have a capuccino at the Second Cup right at the corner where the hotel is before heading back up to our room. The coffee shop is open till very late at night, so it's great. Besides, we got our exercise out of the walk. The only complaint we might have is the heating. It's a bit excessive in the hallway. But we could open our window in the room to let cool air in, so it's not too bad. After all, this is not the Queen Elizabeth, and we shouldn't expect that level of opulence, considering what we paid. In fact, we were so pleased with our previous stay that we are going to stay there again this Christmas (2004).

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected.......”
Reviews.Author: BBora
Reviews.Content: Frankly, almost cancelled my reservation after reading some of the reviews here. But decided that we were unwilling to pay $150 and up for a better hotel. Room was basic, but clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Some of the common areas required maintenance. Generally, well located and good value for $100.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Maritime Plaza”
Reviews.Author: KittianQueen
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the previous reviews of this hotel I was a bit nervous about staying there. Anyhow, I had a positive experience. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and accomodating. Everyone spoke great English. The room (looked nothing like what's on their website) but was clean and very spacious. The hotel is in a very very convenient location. It's a block away from the nearest Metro stop (Guy-Concordia). Up the street and around the corner there's a plaza that has restaurants, ATM's (the hotel has an ATM machine also), a fresh fruit market and plenty of other stores. There is also a pharmacy and a McDonalds up the street and around the corner in the other direction. Also the hotel is located between Rue Ste. Catherine and Boulevard Rene Levesque. Rue Ste. Catherine is a major shopping area (there are plenty of stores for every sort of budget). In addition the hotel is only minutes away from Eaton Center (Underground City). There are also plenty of restaurants in the immediate vicinty of the hotel (to mention a few there is BBQ Ribs place, a Vietnamese restaurant, an Indian place around the corner on Rene Levesque, and on and on). There is a restaurant in the hotel but I can't comment on how good the food is because I didn't eat there as I found them to be rather expensive. The hotel also has a bar, a pool, and a small workout area. I found this hotel to be excellent and will definitely stay there again on any subsequent trips to Montreal.
